loans.name: Vengie

texts.en:
Vengie is a married man and a father of two children, aged nine and five years old. Vengie is also engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He is also into a farming business. These are the sources of his income. 

Vengie is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Vengie hopes to make his business a success thus augmenting his income.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Kahonzi

texts.en:
Kahonzi is a fifty-two-year-old livestock farmer in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three, whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last twenty-four years and has done great.

This marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business, she has repaid the other loans successfully. She will use the loan to build a structure for calves and a milking shed.

The anticipated profit will be used to buy water tanks for her livestock. She hopes to dominate the milk supply market in her community in future.

loans.use: to build a structure for calves and a milking shed.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Necitas has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Necitas has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 53 years old and widowed with two children. With one child in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Letecia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Letecia has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Letecia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable and food vending. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rolanor

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rolanor works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Rolanor is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like sandals, slippers, blouses, etc. to sell.

Rolanor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like sandals, slippers, blouses to sell

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Tomasita has been in this business for 10 years. Tomasita earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Tomasita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish and meat for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy liquid fertilizer, manure and fertilizer to help her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 38-year-old tailor in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of two and her spouse provides additional income. Anna has been in this business for the last four years and she is doing great.

This marks Anna's fourth borrowing to finance her business after repaying her loans faithfully. Anna will use the loan to purchase clothing material for her shop and use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to grow her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material for her shop

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ah solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
José Carlos is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti which has a hot climate. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, and animal raising. The community is located in Chiclayo Province, part of the region of Lambayeque on Peru's northern coast.

José Carlos works in transportation and drives his own rickshaw taxi. He carries passengers from distant villages to his district. He is seeking a loan of 1,500 soles to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle so that he can continue to offer a good service to his clients.

loans.use: Buy spare parts and service his vehicle

loans.name: Masis

texts.en:
Masis is 33 years old. He lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. He is married and he lives with his parents, his wife and his two children. His parents are retired and now Masis is the only bread-winner in his family. 

For 5 years Masis worked as a contractual military serviceman, but after getting married he established his own small business which till today gives him the chance to earn more money for his family. He does domestic appliance repair works in a small garage near his house. He has loyal customers thanks to whom he sustains his family. 

Masis is rather worried since lately his mother feels unhealthy and weak. He wants to bring her to Yerevan city and with the help of doctors to find the reason why his mother feels so ill.

Massis asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for a good medical examination for his mother and if needed, to start some course of treatment.

loans.use: to pay for a good medical examination for his mother and if needed, to start a course of treatment.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with 12 children. She is a very hard -working entrepreneur. Narcisa is 52 years old and has three children currently in school.

Narcisa has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and other supplies for her business.

Narcisa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Lucresia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Lucresia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.en:
Emerciana is 67 years old and widowed with nine children.

Emerciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, etc to sell.

Emerciana has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Emerciana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, etc to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 37 years old. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of History-Geography. Hasmik is a very clever and educated person with 13 years of pedagogical work experience. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Hasmik is devoted both to her profession of pedagogy and to her title of pedagogue as well. Hasmik is married and she has a son, who studies at the paid division of Vanadzor State Medical College at the dental faculty. Hasmik’s daughter is still school-aged. 

Hasmik has already once paid back her Kiva loan which she took for the purchase of a new computer and printer, and she greatly thanks Kiva for that support. Now she hopes to receive one more loan from Kiva and this time she needs it in order to pay for her son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe is a married man, and a father of four children, from Talibon, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income. 

Bernabe is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and more. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Bernabe hopes of making his fishing business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and more

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 22-year-old beauty salon proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single lady who has been in this business for the last five years and has done great.

This marks Janet's first borrowing to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase hair rollers, weaves, and shampoo, and she will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase hair rollers, weaves, and shampoo

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Amelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Arleen is 46 years old and has three children currently in school.

Arleen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, meat, etc for her food production business.

Arleen has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, meat, etc for her food production business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Celsa is 49 years old and has two children currently in school.

Celsa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like hotdogs, meat, chicken, seasonings, etc for her food production business.

Celsa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like hotdogs, meat, chicken, seasonings, etc for her food production business

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Cherlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Cherlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Cherlyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. 

Cherlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shampoo, cereals, coffee, sugar and detergent soap to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear items such as shorts, blouses, pants, etc. to sell.

Edna has been in this business for 16 years now.

Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items such as shorts, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Kelly Mariella

texts.es:
Kelly Mariella tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de mazamorras y tamales preparado por ella misma, desde hace 5 años, cuenta con clientela considerable en su distrito por el buen gusto en la preparación de sus alimentos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ladrillos y calamina para los acabados de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable donde vivir.
texts.en:
Kelly Mariella, 36, lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a community devoted to agriculture, commerce, and ranching located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayaque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She has made a living for five years selling "mazamorra" [maize-based food] and tamales that she makes herself.  She has a lot of customers in her area because of the good flavor of her dishes.

Kelly Mariella has requested a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy bricks and corrugated iron to put the finishing touches on her house so she has a nice place to live.

loans.use: to buy bricks and corrugated iron

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is 47 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Alisa graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Teaching in the Elementary Schools and Teaching Methodologies. Alisa now works at a school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She also has a group of pupils to whom she gives private courses of Armenian Language and Literature so they get prepared for upcoming entrance examinations. 

She likes her work very much and tries always to be aware of any methodological innovations in teaching and she uses it to make her lessons interesting and attractive for her pupils. 

Alisa is married. She has a son who works at the gas station, and a daughter who is already married and lives with her family.

Alisa is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and find a lot of interesting information that may be useful in her teaching process.

loans.use: to buy a computer and find a lot of interesting information that may be useful in her teaching process.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Chona is 45 years old and both her children are in school.

Chona has a buy and sell beauty products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers.

Chona has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Chona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Dulcesima works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dulcesima is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Dulcesima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving nough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old tailor in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a widow who supports eight children, and for the past sixteen years has been in this business and doing great.

This marks Ali's first loan to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase a second sewing machine and the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase a second sewing machine

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and mother of five children, from Talibon, Bohol. Emma earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked snack foods like banana and camote cue (deep fried banana and camote in caramelized sugar), and steamed cassava cake. 

Emma is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sugar, sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava, and baking powder. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Emma hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, sweet potatoes, bananas, cassava, and baking powder

loans.name: Buscando El Exito  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito está formado por 10 socias quienes en su mayoría trabajan en un mercado de la ciudad, realizan diferentes actividades de comercio como la venta de frutas, verduras o en la preparación y venta de comida, estos negocios les dan la oportunidad de mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene un clima frió, su Centro Histórico es una mezcla de la arquitectura moderna y colonial, cuenta con variada gastronomía típica la que deleita el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente aun mantiene viva su cultura y tradiciones. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Blanca, tiene 56 años de edad, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Blanca se dedica desde hace 7 años a la veta de  comida, trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día, el resto de su tiempo se dedica a la limpieza de casas, estos trabajos le han permitido mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus productos. Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Buscando el Éxito (Seeking Success) Community Bank has ten members, most of whom work in a market in the town selling such items as fruit or vegetables, or preparing and selling food. These businesses give them the opportunity to improve their household income and get ahead with their families. They live in different places in Cuenca, a city with a cold climate. Its historic centre is a mixture of modern and colonial architecture. The local food is varied and delights the palates of visitors. The people still  maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members is 56-year old Sra. Blanca. She is divorced but has five children from her marriage, four of whom are married and live independently, while the the fifth is single and is a student at a local college. The house where she lives is her own.

Sra. Blanca has earned her living for seven years selling food half days from Monday to Friday. The rest of the time she cleans houses. The income from these two jobs has allowed her to improve the financial stability of her household.

Blanca plans to use the loan money to buy ingredients for the food she sells. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Hermila

texts.en:
Hermila works hard to support her family. Hermila is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Hermila has been in this business for 6 years now.

Hermila requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Hermila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, zippers, threads, etc., for her business.

Janice has been in this business for 16 years. Janice earns more income from her general store.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, zippers, threads, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell. Judith has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like cooking oil, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region. He is married and he has 2 school-aged sons. His wife does not work and she takes care of their family. 

Previously Garik used to work at the gas station, but now on his own bus he takes passengers from the village of Kurtan to Vanadzor city. In this village Garik knows nearly everybody, since he was born here. He does his work with great pleasure and care as among his passengers he always meets his playmates, schoolmates, and neighbors. Garik passed his whole childhood in this village. 

He helps the farmers to transfer their farm products to the city for sale and also transfers students who study in Vanadzor city. All the people that travel daily on his bus respect and love Garik very much, and they say that on the way from the village to the city they pass the time enjoying different conversations, making jokes, and remembering different stories from their youth.

Garik takes care of his bus properly as it is the only source of income for his family and also the only vehicle for the people from their village to the city. So he needs this loan amount in order to do some repair work on his bus and also to buy new tyres.

loans.use: to do some repair work on his bus and buy some new tyres

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María Petronila tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, gallos y cerdos para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y cerdos pequeños para posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
María Petronila, 39, lives with her husband and children in the Nueva Arica district, a farming, commercial, and ranching community located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  She makes a living raising and selling barnyard animals, ducks, roosters, and pigs to help her husband with the family expenses.

María Petronila has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 3,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy balanced feed and piglets to sell later at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and piglets

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 36 years old, is married and has three children. For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

 Analyn has previously borrowed 10 times to sustain her business. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children. Esterlita has been engaged in the seaweed farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Esterlita is asking for a loan  to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope. With this she will be able to improve the productivity of her seaweed farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Esterlita dreams of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
In 2012 a group of ten women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Maa Mangala Self-Help Group. Manasi was selected as the leader of Maa Mangala SHG. The lady standing with her raised hand is Manasi. 

Manasi is 27 years old, married, and living with her husband and five children. She has been involved in a milk business for two years. She has one cow and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to supply the growing demand of the customers in the market. 

She has applied for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and also wants to repair her cattle shed. This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education and to pay her children's tuition fee.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her milk business.

loans.name: Rosmawati

texts.en:
Rosmawati is a 37-year-old widow.  She has 3 children; Titania - 17, a 2nd year senior high school student;  Cindy - 14, in her 3rd year of junior high school;  and Windy - 9, in her 3rd year of elementary school.

She has been running a kiosk business since 2000 selling daily needs such as rice, instant noodles, soap, detergent, etc.  3 years ago she established a new kiosk in the weekly market using her own capital. Her income from the business can help her to cover the needs of her family. 

Currently, Rosmawati is seeking business capital that can help her to add to her kiosk stock with a variety of daily needs.  Therefore, she requested an individual loan from TLM in the amount of 10,000,000 IDR.  The loan is used for kiosk stock such as rice, flour, sugar, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to buy kiosk stock such  as rice, flour, sugar, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi is 45 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom works abroad to help the family with monthly remittances. Being a responsible mother, Yi aims to improve her family's standard of living and give them a better lifestyle, especially their education. Yi is engaged in a farming business, which is her major source of income. Her husband and children give her full support in managing their farm. 

Yi will use this loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Yi is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a twenty-six-year-old motorcycle operator in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married man who supports no one and has been in this business for the last five years, doing great.

This marks his third time borrowing to finance his business after repaying his loan successfully. He will use the loan to service his motorcycle and open a new business and the anticipated profit to purchase a second motorcycle and employ one person. He hopes to own a public service vehicle in future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and open a new business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julita is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Julita has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her rope-making business.

Julita has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her rope-making business

loans.name: Luchemie

texts.en:
Luchemie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luchemie is 30 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Luchemie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luchemie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Luchemie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more items for her grocery store.

She would like to apply for a new loan to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for resale. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Nitaigouranga Shg Group

texts.en:
These 11 women from the small village of Odisha came together and formed Nitaigouranga SHG in 2012. Minakhi was selected as the leader of Nitaigouranga SHG. The lady who is standing with her raised hand is Minakhi. 

Minakhi is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her husband has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her husband has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. What they earn is not sufficient to manage their family. She has requested a loan to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widowed woman with four adult children.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food 

She has operated a butchery business for the last ten years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mbeyu is requesting a loan to buy goats and cows for her business, and decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Joyce

texts.en:
Ma. Joyce is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Joyce is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Joyce has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like pork, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Joyce has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Ma. Joyce would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Macvil

texts.en:
Maria Macvil works hard to support her family. Maria Macvil is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Maria Macvil requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Maria Macvil would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 36 years old and she lives in the village of Agarak in the Lori region. She lives with her parents-in-law and 14-year-old daughter. Her husband is away (abroad) working in the Russian Federation, and from time-to- ime he transfers money and sustains his family from afar. 

In the village, the only source of income for Astghik’s family is from farming and agriculture. Astghik has five cows on her farm, and on her plot of land she cultivates potatoes. Her husband’s parents help her a little, but they are already old and unhealthy, so mainly she manages everything about the farm alone. She sells her farm milk and macun (Armenian national dairy product) to the village people. 

In order for get ready for spring sowing activities and to buy new type of potato seedlings and some fertilizer, Astghik asks a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams. 

Beforehand, she thanks Kiva for the support, which will be of great use for her farm.

loans.use: for spring sowing activities, to buy a new type of potato seedlings, and for some fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 36 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mary Ann has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 36 years old and married with six children. With all six children currently in school, Narfe works very hard to provide for them.

Narfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Narfe has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Narfe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is Florence, a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.  She appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her vegetable stall business.

Florence wants to purchase iron sheets that she will use to renovate her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase iron sheets and pay for labor costs.  She joined Yehu to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Beja

texts.en:
Beja is a married woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women.  She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Beja is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 40 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Shelmith, and they are blessed with three children, ages 19, 17, and 12 years old.

He has been running his farming business for the last seven years, and to enable him buy fertilizer and beans planting seeds, he has applied for his third loan of KES. 35,000 from VisionFund  Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 20, 000.  He has plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and bean planting seeds

loans.name: Hrach

texts.en:
Hrach lives with his family in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He has two sons, both are now contractual soldiers and his daughter, who is already married, lives separately with her family. 

Harch’s wife is unemployed, and Hrach is the only bread winner in his family. Now he works as an inspector at the parking of city wholesale market. As Hrach says, all day long he communicates with people a lot, and he has some problems with his teeth.

He needs this loan in an amount 160,000 Armenian drams in order to buy dentures, which will be of great support for him.  

He will be able to communicate with people without shame.

loans.use: to buy dentures.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien, 39, is married with two children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband supports the family by working as a carpenter.  Lien started a general store twelve years ago, which helps her to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

Lien is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City.  In the picture she is second from the left holding a blue paper.  Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.  

Lien is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of households items and beverages to restock her store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different household items and soft drinks to stock her general store

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives and works in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region of Armenia. Karine has a higher education pedagogue; she graduated Tbilisi State Linguistic University, the faculty of Russian Language and Literature.  For 14 years she worked at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature.  

Since 2000 she has worked at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute as a lecturer of Russian Language and Literature.  She is greatly respected and teaches a clever pedagogue, and does her work with an enormous sense of responsibility and love. She helps and supports her students, and thanks to her correct methodological work with students, during her lectures the auditorium is always full of students.  She also gives private courses that help the pupils prepare for the entrance examinations. 

Karine is married and she has two sons and a daughter. Her sons work with their father at the clothes production workshop, which is a family business of their own, and her daughter is a highly qualified dentist.

Karine requests a loan of 600,000 Armenian Drams which she needs to purchase a computer, methodological literature, and some new dictionaries.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, methodological literature, and some new dictionaries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coal, oil, pepper, drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang, 43, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Trang's husband works in a local company. 

For the past 20 years, Trang has been running a beauty shop from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Trang is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is sitting on the right and is wearing a black and grey striped short-sleeved shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Trang is requesting a loan to repair and upgrade her beauty shop. 

She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To repair and upgrade her beauty shop

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
This young, charming lady’s name is Varsenik; she lives with her parents in a nice city, Dilijan. She is 21 years old. 

She has a higher education and a specialty of pedagogue. Now she probationary works at the school, and if she successfully passes this period, in the same school she will work as a teacher of English language and literature. Varsenik’s sister and brother are students; her mother is a housewife and the only bread winner in their family is her father. Now he works in the Russian Federation, and he sends money and sustains his family from afar. 

As Varsenik says, the lack of money makes them always spend it only for urgent family needs. She decided to make a surprise for her family.

She asks for this loan to purchase a new TV for her family; and if some money is left from this loan, she will also buy any kind of kitchen appliance, which will be a good present and of great use for her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a new TV, and with left over money, a kitchen appliance

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a guitar-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Sally is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her guitar-making business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 to purchase additional feed for her pigs. 

Josephine has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from her general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1981. She is married and has three children, who are not adults.  

Firuza is a sewer; she sews wonderful women’s dresses. She has worksed in this field more than six years. She services her clients in her house. As she lives in a rural area, there is no big business struggle in her region. She has her regular customers. Firuza is a repeated client of IMON. She has a good credit story. 

Firuza is going to buy furniture for her household. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old and comes from Nyahururu. He is married to Tabitha and they are blessed with five children aged 17, 16, 14, 10 and four years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last fifteen years, and to enable him buy maize seeds to plant, fertilizer and a heifer, he has applied for his second loan of KES. 71,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 40,000 and he plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children, buy some more dairy cows, and pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Charles hopes to be an established farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like maize seeds, fertilizer, and also a heifer

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, cereals, noodles, detergent, soap, etc. to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snack foods, sugar, cereals, noodles, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Armavir town where she lives with her in-laws and husband. Her husband and father-in-law are army officers. For two years already, Mariam has been providing classes to school-aged children from her house. Due to her kind attitude toward children, Mariam is well known among the locals of Armavir town. 

Now, in order to be able to purchase materials (stationery) and tablets needed for her work, she has applied for this loan. That is very important for Mariam to make her work more effective and provide better quality training to the children. 

Mariam has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials (stationery) and tablets for providing training

loans.name: Ladik

texts.en:
Ladik is just 19 years old and he lives with his parents and brother in Dilijan city. He has a vocational education, and already has worked at a private construction company as a bricklayer for four years. Despite his young age, he is rather skilled and adept in his work, and he does his work accurately. 

Ladik says that for him, his work interesting and he never gets tired of it. He also does any construction work that may occur in their house; so he is just a handy man. Ladik’s father is also in construction, and he is always ready to give good and useful advice to his son connected with his work. 

Lately Ladik is a little bit worried about his health, since during his work very often he gets tired and feels weakness, which he never felt before. After passing an examination at the local polyclinics, it turned out that he has an inflammation of the gallbladder. For some time he has felt pains in his gallbladder, but he did not pay attention to it and he thought that it would pass soon. 

His doctor recommended him to be urgently operated.

He needs this loan amount in order to pay for his surgery, and finally to get rid of these problems connected with his health, and continue to live and work as he used to.

loans.use: to pay for his gall bladder surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Pulod

texts.en: Pulod is 36 years old. He is a hardworking and smart man. Pulod lives with his family in the south part of Tajikistan. Pulod is careful father of 3 children. He is the breadwinner for his family, as his wife is a housewife. Pulod is an engineer. He has worked in this field more than 4 years. He works hard and tries to improve his living condition. Pulod has also grows fruit trees. He has a garden full of trees. There are apricots, apples, cherries and etc. in his garden. Pulod must use mineral fertilizers on trees, but he has not enough money. He is asking for a loan of 1000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Aryanto

texts.en:
Aryanto is a 28-year-old man who is married to Meriani, a 21-year-old woman. They have a son namely Felian, a 4-year-old boy.

To make money, Aryanto is working as motorcycle taxi driver (ojek). He has been involved in the business since 2002. The income generated from the business is about IDR 1,200,000 each month. In order to make more income he initiated a business selling gasoline. He spent the amount of IDR 400,000 to buy gasoline. Since the business is running well, he decided to initiate a kiosk business. 

At the moment he needs more money to repair his motorcycle; therefore he requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,500,000. The loan will be spent on motorcycle tires, a disc clutch, an automatic clutch and kiosk stock such as rice, cooking oil, gasoline, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a disc clutch, and an automatic clutch for his motorcycle and kiosk stock such as rice, cooking oil, gasoline, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates the previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mariam runs a small cafe in the center of Kapan town. She provides fresh food to her customers, working hard to maintain high quality service. The space which Mariam rents for her cafe is small, but her plans and desire to enlarge it are very big. Realizing that her small start-up business is sustainable enough for covering monthly payments, she has requested a loan. 

The loan will greatly help Mariam to purchase new chairs and tables and will give her an opportunity to enlarge her business. Mariam has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for chairs and tables for a small cafe

loans.name: Araksya

texts.en:
Araksya is happy to have her second loan with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon. Her large family also sends their warm greetings and thanks for this great support. Araksya lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. She has three children, her son and younger daughter are school-aged and her elder daughter is a student of Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute at the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. She studies at the paid division and Araksya’s first Kiva loan helped her to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester. 

Araksya has her own small business making pastries, which she sells in the city's food markets. Her husband works as a furniture maker. Their financial hardships and the needs of their family don't allow them the chance to build savings. Araksya hopes that another loan with Kiva lenders will help her pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Jose Rosendo

texts.es:
José Rosendo tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando los alimentos para brindarles a los jornaleros que trabajan dando mantenimiento al cultivo de café, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de compost, humus, entre otros para abonar sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una producción buena para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Rosendo is 48 years old and he lives together with his wife and kids in the district of Callayuc.  This community has a cool climate and its people make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  It is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

The borrower makes a living in agriculture, specifically in cultivating coffee.  His wife supports him in this work; she prepares the food and meals that they offer the day laborers who help with the coffee crops.

He has requested this loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 soles.  He will buy compost, humus, and other items in order to fertilizer his crops.  In doing this, he will have a good production to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy compost and humus to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sarine

texts.en:
Sarine is from Ijevan town where she lives with her 7-year-old daughter. She is a mother of three sons as well, and her youngest son currently serves in the army and the other two are migrant workers in a neighboring country with their father.
 
As a hardworking mother of the family, Sarine herself has been running a small start-up business. She makes pastries and sells them locally. Due to her talent for making very tasty cookies and pastries, she receives a lot of orders during a month. Now Sarine has applied for this loan in order to be able to purchase some tools and materials needed for her work.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with favorable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for making pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Imomaly

texts.en:
Imomaly was born in 1967 and is a married father of 3 children. His wife is a kind woman who is a housewife. 

Imomaly has been working in transportation for more than 15 years, and has a lot of experience in this field. He has his regular clients thanks to his good service. His business is the only source of family income so he works hard.

Now his truck is broken and he needs to repair it but he doesn't have any money. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to repair his truck. 

He gratefully awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un joven emprendedor y activo de 21 años de edad, recién egresado de la universidad, donde realizó estudios de licenciatura para ser docente, solventaba sus gastos con los ingresos que obtiene por la venta de calzado, lo que le permitió culminar sus estudios y actualmente es su principal fuente de ingresos para apoyar a su madre con la carga económica del hogar. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido de ropa interior y calzado, así tendrá mayor variedad para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando los ingresos.
Gustavo sueña con poder ejercer su profesión como docente y generar mejores ingresos para aportar en mayor proporción a la economía familiar y velar por el bienestar de su madre y sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a young, active entrepreneur. He is 21 years old and recently graduated from a university where he obtained his bachelor's degree, majoring in education. Gustavo paid his expenses with earnings from his shoe sales, which allowed him to finish his education and is currently his primary source of income. Gustavo helps his mother financially to maintain their home. 

He will invest this loan to buy an assortment of shoes and underwear so that he has a wider variety to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers, which will increase his earnings. Gustavo dreams of being able to become a teacher and generate a better income to help more with his family's expenses and to take care of this mother and his siblings.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two steers.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana es una joven muy entusiasta y con deseos de superación, está acompañada, tiene un hijo y actualmente viven en casa de su suegro. 

Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos como: cocinar, lavar, planchar, y ademas visita a su mamá cada semana para llevarle algo de comer y ademas le hace compañía.
Ana necesita de este préstamo para celebrar el cumpleaños de su hijo, pues como toda madre que ama a su hijo ella desea darle la alegría de festejarle su cumpleaños.
su sueño es ver a su hijo graduando de bachiller y ademas obtener una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is a very enthusiastic young woman with great dreams to improve herself.  She is in a relationship and has one son.  They currently live in her parents-in-law's house.

Ana is dedicated to the household chores like cooking, washing, ironing, and also visiting her mother every week to bring her some food and to keep her company.

Ana needs this loan in order to celebrate her son's birthday.  Every mother that loves her child wants to be able to provide him with the happiness associated with celebrating their birthday.

Her dream is to see her son graduate from high school, and to then go on and study at the university.

loans.use: to celebrate her son's birthday.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 33-year-old married woman. She is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community, and her business earns enough to lead a decent life. She is very knowledgeable about stitching techniques. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40000 to buy threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, in order to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues for personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
34-year-old Memory is a business woman living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother with two children as well as being an aspiring entrepreneur, striving to be economically independent. With her many achievements, Memory inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs. 

She started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers. She also sells eggs which she gets from her laying hens. 

With this Kiva loan, Memory will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chickens and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, she will increase her profits and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chickens and chick feed

loans.name: Mussarrat

texts.en:
Mussarrat is a 37-year-old married woman who runs a business selling goats. She buys baby goats at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at a profit. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family income. 

She needs to improve her business to better support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Langelihle

texts.en:
Langelihle is 22 years old and lives in the Nkayi District, Zimbabwe. Langelihle has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students and enhance their learning environment. As an entrepreneur, Langelihle also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for nine months now and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With the Kiva loan, Langelihle will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase and diversify her inventory. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell at the flea market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking supplies for her shop

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de San Lorenzo, una zona rural del distrito de Pimpingos una comunidad de clima variado, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería posee seis reses de su propiedad, con cuatro has. de inverna pasto natural de la zona, cria su ganado, su esposa le apoya ordeñando el ganado lechero para ofrecer la leche fresca y en queso a sus vecinos y personas de su caserío, también se dedica a la venta de maíz amarillo.

Edilberto ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevo soles para la compra de ganado vacuno tierno para ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un precio mayor.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the community of San Lorenzo, a rural zone in the district of Pimpingos, a community with a varied climate located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, the northern sierra of Peru.

He works with cattle. He owns six heads of cattle and has six hectares of native grass. He raises his cattle and his wife helps him by milking the dairy cows to sell fresh milk and cheese to their neighbors and people from their community. He also sells yellow corn.

Edilberto has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 nuevo soles to buy young cattle to offer his customers at a better price.

loans.use: to buy cattle to offer his customers.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. He had a vocational education and for 25 years he worked at the machinery factory. Now he works at the National Statistical Office as an agronomist-researcher. He is not married and now, despite being employed, he also has a lot of time to spend on farming and agricultural activities.  

Gagik has a small farm in the nearby village of Srashen, where he has several cows and a calf, and 10 chickens. On his plot of land he can cultivate potatoes, cabbages, beans and carrots very successfully, and has apple, plum and pear trees. All the harvest from his farm he sells locally. Gagik says that since he lives alone, he has few personal needs and manages to take care of his farm properly and with great pleasure.

Gagik needs this loan amount in order to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel for sowing activities

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, wheat flour, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, wheat flour, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat is a 45-year-old married woman who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to increase her revenues and generate a healthier source of income. This is her third loan cycle and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Ghulam  Narjis

texts.en:
Ghulam Narjis is a 37-year-old married mother of four. She has a business selling garments with her husband. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. 

Ghulam Narjis purchases cloth from the market, stitches articles of clothing, and sells them to the people of her locality. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses, and she has requested a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase bundles of cloth, reels of threads, and packs of buttons and laces. With these materials, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her regular customers, who are her neighbors and the local community. Ghulam Narjis hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth, reels of threads, and packs of buttons and laces

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 33 años, esta casado. Él solo logro sacar noveno grado, Es padre de 3 hijos uno estudia tercer grado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, él trabaja en la venta de pan desde hace 6 años, dicho trabajo lo realiza todas las mañana desde la 3 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la mañana.  Porque el trabajo de jornalero que tiene no lo alcanza para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por dicha razón él realiza el trabajo de venta de pan y con los ingresos que adquiere ya le da un sustento mas para la alimentación de sus hijos y esposa.

Con el crédito comprara tres vacas lecheras para criarlas para luego de un tiempo poder venderlas y poder obtener ganancias para salir adelante con sus hijos y esposa y darles un buen futuro.

EL mas grande de sus sueños es poder tener una mejor casa para estar con toda su familia y que sus hijos lleguen a ser gente de bien y que logren sacar sus estudios para que sea unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Manuel is thirty-three years old and is married.  He only studied through the ninth grade.  He has three children; one is studying in the third grade.  His wife is dedicated to the household chores.  Manuel has worked a second job selling bread for six years; he does this every morning from 3:00am-7:00am.  

He does not make enough money at his job as a day laborer in order to cover the home expenses.  For this reason, he also sells bread.  With this income, he is able to buy extra food for his wife and children.

He will buy three dairy cows with the loan.  He will take care of them and then later be able to sell them; this will allow him to earn more income and to move himself forward with his kids and wife.  He wants to offer them a better future.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a better house so that he can be with his entire family.  He also wants his children to grow up to be good people and to move forward with their studies so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 32-year-old married woman who works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are very in demand and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. With these materials, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. Azra dreams of a bright future for her children and desires to build her own house. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Iness

texts.en:
Iness is a 29-year-old mother of two living in the Nkayi district of Zimbabwe. For the last seven months, she has been successfully operating a grocery store in her district. In her grocery store, Iness sells cooking oil, flour, sugar, rice, salt, biscuits, sweets and candles. She has not yet been able to employ anyone because of a lack of funds to invest in her business. Iness volunteers her free time taking care of those in her community who are affected by and infected with HIV and AIDS. 

With this Kiva loan, Iness will purchase bulk groceries from wholesale retailers to increase her sales volume and profits. An increase in business means Iness will continue to be financially independent and support her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Marble

texts.en:
Marble is a 33-year-old businesswoman living in the Chikomba East District. She is married with two children. She started her poultry business after noticing an increase in the demand for broiler chickens and thought it was a great opportunity to create another source of income. She currently produces about 150 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers. As an entrepreneur, Marble inspires young women in her community to continue their education. 

Marble knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for her two children, she is unable to use her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed. Marble hopes to use her increased profits to care for her two children and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large bale of clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad tranquila, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como cerdos, patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, desde hace 5 años, realiza esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún, a peaceful community. Its residents mostly work in agriculture, trade and cattle. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling animals such as pigs, ducks, and chickens for 5 years. She does this activity to help her husband with the household expenses. She has asked for 1,500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Mme Djélika est âgée de 52 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle réside avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier  Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle a prématurément abandonné les études, ainsi elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se   baser  sur l’achat- vente de bois de chauffe il y a plus de 9 ans.
Le bois est l’un des éléments essentiel pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation (cuisine),  raisons pour laquelle Mme Djelika peut vendre 3 chargements de Remorque par mois.  A L’approche de l’hivernage d’où  le moment des ruptures de stock, afin de combattre cette rupture, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a plus de deux ans, dont elle est à son 4ème prêt. Mme Djélika  envisage utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat  des chargements de remorque en bois de chauffe dans les villages  environnants  de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte au quartier Kôkô à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt en plus de son fonds propre, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Avec ce financement sa perspective est bonne car elle va combattre les ruptures de stock qu’elle subissait auparavant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djélika is 52 years old. She is married with three children and she lives with her husband and children in the Kôkô quarter of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region). She stopped her studies early on then went into money making activities. After several unsuccessful jobs, she ended up over nine years ago taking up the commerce of firewood.
Wood is one of the essential elements in cooking for the Mali women, which is why Mrs. Djélika can sell up to three cartloads per month. With the winter coming, which is the period when there is little stock, she did not take the time to return to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom she is on her fourth loan in order to avoid this shortage over two years ago. Mrs. Djélika plans to use this loan for the purchase of cartloads of firewood in the villages around Koutiala. She sells the wood outside her home in the Kôkô quarter for cash to a mixed clientele.
With this loan in addition to her capital stock, she plans to make an average monthly profit of 150 000FCFA which she will use to repay the interest to Soro, participate in the daily expenditure of her family, and the remainder she will re-invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es: Luz, es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, vive en Tulcán, es alegre y muy amable, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos son varones y ya tienen su propio hogar y su hija de 26 años. Ella se dedica a preparar comidas en un restaurante de su propiedad, prepara platos como fritada, caldo de gallina, pescado frito entre otros, su hija le ayuda en el negocio. Ella inicio esta actividad por falta de fuentes de empleo en la ciudad desde ya hace 25 años atrás, desde entonces su negocio ha ido creciendo. Ella necesita el préstamo para adecuaciones de su local, como cambiar las mesas que ya están un poco viejas y pintar la fachada del restaurante. Su sueño es poder tener un local más grande donde pueda atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is a 49 year-old woman who is married, happy and very pleasant. She lives in Tulcán and has three children.  Two of them are young men who have their own home, and she has a daughter who is 26. Luz sells meals in her own restaurant and makes such dishes as fried pork, chicken soup, and fried fish. Her daughter helps with the business. 

Luz began this business 25 years ago due to lack of employment opportunities in her city, and since that time her business has been growing. She needs this loan so she can make improvements such as replacing the tables which are a little old, and painting the front of the restaurant.  Her dream is to have a larger place where she can serve more customers.

loans.use: make improvements to her restaurant such as buying new tables and painting the front.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 51-year-old married woman.  She has been successfully running a business selling milk with her husband. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and thus makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  

To meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Kaneez has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behaviour.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad de clima variado su población es amable la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provinia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pollos y gallinas y lo comercializan en los restaurants y mercado de su distrito, son una familia unida, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como postes, mallas y otros para el arreglo de la infraestructura de sus corrales y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
José is 67 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun.  This community has a varied climate, and its people are kind.
