The majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  Oyotun is located in the Chiclayo province and belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living with his wife raising, buying, and selling small animals like chickens and hens.  He sells the animals to restaurants and the local market.  He has a very united family.  

José has requested this loan for 1,600 soles in order to buy materials like posts, chicken wire, and other items to fix up the farmyard and coops.  A second part of the loan will be used to buy animal feed to fatten his animals.

loans.use: to buy farmyard materials and animal feed in order to fatten his animals.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro, es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero, es muy alegre y trabajador. Se dedica a la panadería desde ya 20 años atrás, tiene un pequeño local donde elabora el pan y los vende. El necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas de panadería que le ayude a mejorar la elaboración de sus productos. Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia y un local más grande para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Ramiro is 38 years old.  He is single and is a very happy and hardworking man.  He has made a living at his bakery for 20 years.  He has a small shop where he makes and sells the bread.  

He needs the loan in order to buy bakery tools; this will help him to improve his production processes.  His dream is to be able to have his own house and a larger storefront in order to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools that will help him improve production at his bakery.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 58-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth to the people of her community. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Sharifan is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 51-year-old lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, Rukhsana requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy sacks of grains, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy sacks of grains, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 44 years old and she lives in Sevan city in Gergharkunik region. She has a higher education and a specialty as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. For many years she worked at the school as a teacher and now at the same school she is a deputy director. Lusine is married and she has a son, who is now in the army passing his military service, and a daughter who is already a student. Lusine's husband is the chief veterinarian of Gegharkunik region and he is always busy with his visits to the villages. 

Lusine is asking for a loan since she wants to buy a computer which she needs at home very much since often she has a lot of work to do and she must work at home also.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use at home also.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Nurhayati is a 30-year-old woman and is married to Saleh, a 38-year-old entrepreneur. They are blessed with two children: Iskandar, 9, in the 2nd grade of Elementary school; and Rizki, 3.

Nurhayati owns a kiosk business selling daily needs such as cooking oil, detergent, instant noodles, ketchup, etc. She has been running the business since 2004. From the business she can generate IDR 100,000 in income per day. In addition, she produces the cakes to sell at her husband's work place. 

At the moment, she plans to buy the rice and other items to stock for her business however she needs more money to do so. She requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000. The loan will be used on fix the electricity in her house and to buy more stock such as rice, instant noodles, snacks, and gasoline for her kiosk business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, instant noodles, snacks, and gasoline for her kiosk business and to fix the electricity in her house

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años de edad,  que actualmente se encuentra estudiando su primer año de  bachillerato, es soltero vive junto con su madre y un hermano que al igual que él se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, José es el hermano menor de cuatro, los otros 2 y su padre se encuentran en el extranjero pero que igual recibe la ayuda siempre.

José la actividad productiva que tiene, es una tienda en su casa que junto a su madre la administren ellos comparten el trabajo y han sabido administrar el negocio tiene ya 5 años de tener la tienda y que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos; es por esta razón que le permite seguir estudiando, también otra actividad productiva que tienen que le genera ingresos económicos a él y su madre es la ganadería producen leche y sus derivados y que es un aporte extra económicamente para ellos, también reciben el apoyo de su hermano;  en los tiempos libres que él estudia en la universidad y no siempre pasa en casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar productos de la canasta básica, de higiene personal y productos del hogar; pues ellos han visto que les hacen falta muchos productos en su tienda y que sus clientes le buscan estos productos. Gracias al préstamo le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servició a sus  clientes y pues de esta manera generarle más ingresos económicos,  esto era un deseo que tenía junto a su madre de mejorar la tienda.

José piensa para el futuro seguir estudiando hasta poder terminar su carrera preferida, que es ingeniería civil  siempre ha deseado ser ingeniero pero que con la ayuda de a Dios y el esfuerzo de mucho trabajo lo lograra. Para su familia siempre ha deseado lo mejor para  su madre, su padre y sus demás hermanos, y también desea ampliar más la tienda en un local más grande, todo esto lo lograra gracias a los ganancias de la tienda y también en futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
José is 20 years old. Currently he is studying in his first year at a university. José is single and lives with his mother and brother who is also studying in college. José is the oldest of four siblings, his other two siblings and his father are living abroad still help the family out.

José owns a small store that he runs with his mother. Together they share the work and have managed the store for the last five years. This business generates a good income for their family. For this reason, he is studying. José and his mother also generate income by raising livestock and selling their milk and dairy products. Income from this activity is an extra support for them. In addition, they receive support from José's brother. In his free time, José studies at his university rather than always staying at home.

The loan José is requesting will be used to buy household items and personal hygiene products since they have been lacking many products in their store and their clients search for these items. Thanks to this loan, José will be able to offer better service to his customers and, in this way, generate better profits. José and his mother have wanted to improve their store in this way.

José plans to continue studying until he finishes his degree in Civil Engineering. He has always wanted to be an engineer, and by the help of God and much hard work, he will do it. José has always wished the best for his mother, father and siblings. He also wants to expand his store in a bigger location. All of these he will accomplish, thanks to the earnings from his store and the future loans that he will request.

loans.use: to buy basic household items and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 24-year-old married woman and her husband is 29 years old. By occupation her husband is a farmer. They have two children, and one is studying in class III (grade 3) while the other one is too small to go to school.  Sultana lives in Dhupguri of the Jalpaiguri District. Sultana is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband completed class IV (grade 4). 

Sultana's husband’s income is too low to run his family. Like every mother, Sultana also dreams of giving her best to her children. She hopes they will not suffer from poverty.  So she has taken an initiative to upgrade their family income and thus plans to cultivate mustard in their field. There is a great demand for mustard in their area. 

She has taken loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for mustard cultivation. She is very much hopeful with her business. She is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for mustard cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, twelve women came together and formed the Maa Santoshi Self Help Group to save money and help those in the group who are facing problems. Hiramani is the group member selected as the leader of Maa Santoshi Self Help Group. The lady standing with raised hand is Hiramani. 

Hiramani is married and has four children. She is 45 years old and lives with her children and her husband. Hiramani has applied for a loan for paddy cultivation. She is very talented and has been operating her business for the past sixteen years. With the loan investment, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges that will allow her to do her work more efficiently. Her husband also helps her in the paddy cultivation.

 Hiramani started her business sixteen years ago because it is difficult for her husband to manage the household expenses in addition to paying for the children's education. Her children are enrolled in local schools and getting an education. She is confident that her children will be able to continue their education and become successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges.

loans.name: Rahena

texts.en:
Rahena is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. Her husband is 50 years old and by trade he is a farmer. Rahena is now a mother of two children who are both receiving education. The elder one is in grade 10 and the younger one in grade 9. 

Rahena is engaged in rearing livestock. She has her own animal husbandry. She wants to increase her animal husbandry business and also wishes to start a milk business. She has taken money from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow so that she can sell milk and milk products like ghee, paneer (fresh cheese), etc., in her locality. 

In the future she dreams of having her milk sales as well as her livestock business flourish.  She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is married with four school-going children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Nadzua has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, cooking oil,  rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat, age 44, is a married woman. She deals in selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida has successfully built her business of sewing shoes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained good number of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she purchased required raw materials. 

To meet with the increasing demands of her customers, currently, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy leather, threads of different colors and packs of needles. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy leather, threads of different colors and packs of needles.

loans.name: Enita

texts.en:
Enita is a 22-year-old single woman living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She started her poultry business as a school project, but later realized that it was a great opportunity for her to be financially independent. She currently produces about 160 chickens every six weeks and sells them locally.   

Enita knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. 

With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks, chick feed and organic manure to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks, chick feed and organic manure.

loans.name: Farooq  Sultana

texts.en:
Farooq Sultana is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Farooq Sultana’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past one year to meet the family expenses but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Farooq Sultana has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her son from Kashf Foundation. Her son wants to buy new tires and rickshaw body. Farooq Sultana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. Her loan is approved.

loans.use: To buy new tires and rickshaw body.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, a 46-year-old married mother of six children, has been selling ready-made shirts for many years. She has become famous in her locale and earns good income that contributes to the family's well-being. 

To meet with increasing customer demand, Naseem needs to purchase ladies' shirts in various colors and designs from the wholesale market. For this, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000, which will help her increase sales and profits. This will be Naseem's fifth loan, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' shirts in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Sk Sk Mandiasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Bini is a 38-year-old lady with four children. She lives in a small village called Chheliapada in Jajpur district of Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started growing vegetables and paddy rice. She grows different types of vegetables in her field, depending upon the demand of her customers and the season. 

The group is requesting a loan of 80,000 INR. Bini will use her part to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is part of a group of eight members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group SK SK Mandiasuni Self Help Group, and it is located in the Jajpur district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of rice, sugar, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is a 35-year-old married woman from Maynaguri with two children. Her husband is 38 years old. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their name.  Her children are studying in higher classes.
 
Uma is a housewife. Her husband sells firewood. In rural areas the demand for firewood is high, as most people use firewood for their cooking. Her husband purchases firewood from the wholesale market and sells it in the local bazaar.

But nowadays his business is not running well due to lack of capital so he cannot not increase his business. Uma decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 10,000 so that they can purchase more firewood from the wholesale market. She hopes to invest the loan amount in their existing business to earn more profit.

She thanks BJS and Kiva both for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase wood for selling in the market.

loans.name: Khateja

texts.en:
Khateja is 44 years old and married. Her husband is 50 years old. She is illiterate but can sign her name. They live in Barghoria which is under Dhupguri region. Khateja has two children. 

Her husband has a fruit business; he sells fruit in the local market and  Khateja runs a grocery shop, but sales have not been up to the mark due to lack of variety of grocery items.  From her friend, Khateja came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and learned that BJS gives loan support to empower rural women. So she applied for a loan to purchase many varieties of grocery items. Now she can fulfill her customers’ needs as well as enhance her grocery business.

 This will help her family financially and she will be able to be a good entrepreneur in the wholesale market.  Now she is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of grocery items to increase the business.

loans.name: Golapi

texts.en:
Golapi is a 28-year-old married woman from Maynaguri, living with her husband and two children. Golapi is a housewife. Her husband sells firewood to the local people who use firewood for cooking. For selling wood, Golapi and her husband need to purchase logs and then cut them into pieces for sale in the local market. 

Golapi wants to purchase more firewood thus she decided to take loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can purchase more firewood. It will help her to extend and increase their business. She hopes she will be able to give a bright future to her children with the help of her business profit.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for their funding.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for selling in the market.

loans.name: Trinath Shg Group

texts.en:
Trinath Self Help Group was formed in 2012 and is composed of nine members in a small village in Odisha. Bhanumati is the lady who is standing with her hand raised in the photograph. 

Bhanumati, aged 42, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Trinath SHG. Bhanumati has two children. She is living with her husband and her two children. Her children are continuing their schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Bhanumati plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques. Both Bhanumati and her husband have been involved in this activity for fifteen years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. 

Bhanumati currently grows rice. She has requested a loan to expand her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to enlarge the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, age 37, has been doing a business manufacturing shoes for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is running her business with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo) and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for her four children including food, health and education. 

It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; currently she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional material such as leather, artificial leather, plastic soles etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market. She wishes to spend part of the revenues on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional material such as leather, artificial leather, plastic soles.

loans.name: Asomdwe Group

texts.en:
The members are part of Asomdwe group and are beginning their first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. It’s made up of three members. The members’ businesses include polo-shirts, fish and home appliances.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Lydia. This is her first loan from ID-Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling polo-shirts and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation.

She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more polo-shirts in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to customers. This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has three children. When asked what she likes abut ID-Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. 

They will need a total amount of GHS 1,500 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more polo-shirts in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
Nomatter is a young woman aged 19, single and living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae association, and is actively involved in empowering graduates to reinvest into their communities by carrying out health and education campaigns. She operates a small retail shop in her community where she sells a variety of grocery products such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, and salt. She started the business in order to create a sustainable source of income. Nomatter’s business has high potential for growth since it is one of the only grocery stores in the area. She would like to expand her business but lacks the funds to do so.

The Kiva loan will enable her to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of inventory and increasing her sales.  In the future, she sees herself being the leading supplier of grocery products in her village. Nomatter hopes her increased business will allow her to create employment in her community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods for her store.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa no posee hijos bajo su responsabilidad, en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de pastos verdes, clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 5 años, su esposa siempre lo apoyado en esta labor, Edilberto ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento del cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Callayuc district, located in Cutervo Province in Cajamarca Region in the Northern Andes of Peru. They have no children who depend on them. The people here in this community of green pastures work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Edilberto works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has done this for 5 years and his wife helps him with the labor. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 PEN to maintain his coffee crops and in this way have better production to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene tiene 56 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y con sus 2 hijos de los cuales uno estudia bachillerato y el orto ayuda a los trabajos de la casa.
Rene se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 20 años, oficio que aprendió viendo y como ayudante de obra. Ademas de construir también cultiva granos básicos como: maíz y frijol.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para que pueda comprar material para construir una cocina detrás de su casa, ya que necesitará comprar piedra, hierro, arena, ladrillo, etc.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse de bachiller y además darles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rene is 56 years old. He lives with his wife and two children, one who is studying at Secondary School and the other helps with the housework. His wife does domestic work.

Rene has been a bricklayer for the past 20 years something he learned working as an assistant at work sites. This loan will help him so that he can buy material to construct a kitchen behind his house. He needs to buy stone, re-bar, sand, brick etc.

His dream is to see his children graduate from high school and go on to study at university.

loans.use: to buy material to build a kitchen behind his house.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 30-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Prankrishna, who is 41 years old. They have two children; one of them is studying in class III (grade 3), and the other is in class II (grade 2).

By profession, Sabita’s husband is a farmer. She wishes to cultivate mustard on her own land to generate more income. Having their own land and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. That is why she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase mustard seeds and fertilizers. Now they want to grow mustard seed in their field. Sabita is confident that she will be able to grow her business.

They don’t have a concrete house, so in the future, she wants to build a concrete house and a grocery shop with the profit she earns from her business. She dreams her children will lead a very successful life with a good education. She is a lady with great enthusiasm, and she never wants to stop fighting.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming mustard seed.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to Subodh, who is 36 years old and a farmer by profession. They both have studied up to grade 5. They have two children studying in school. Jayanti is a dedicated mother as well as a hardworking housewife. Jayanti lives in her own kaccha house, which is made of mud and straw. She works hard from dawn to dusk to upgrade her family’s economic and social condition.

Now Jayanti wants to grow chilies on her own plot of land and sell them in the local market. She came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) loan fund and applied for a loan to buy more chili seeds and fertilizers to grow chilies in a large amount in her own field. She understood that more production of chilies will help them to gain profit from her business. Her contribution should make her business smooth, and she will be able to give a good future to her children, including their education. 

In the future, she desires to make a new poultry farm with the profit from her business.

She really thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase chili seeds and fertilizers for growing chilies.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino tiene 63 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería menor, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a La Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo y venta de plátano, cuenta con cliente la fija en la zona, lo distribuye a las bodegas, juguerias y mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna.
texts.en:
Sabino is 63 years old and lives in Morropon district, located in the province of the same name in Piura region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this community with a hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Sabino works growing and selling bananas. He has regular customers in the area. He sells to warehouses, juice stands and the district market. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN to buy fertilizer to maintain his banana crops and in this way have a properous harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his banana crops.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa Emilia mayor de edad acompañada con dos hijos menores de edad, los dos bajo su responsabilidad, ya que están en estudiando. es originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con su familia paseos familiares, Luisa se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no logro terminar sus estudios por lo que inicia su negocio desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos familiares, gracias a su espíritu y ganas de salir adelante empieza su negocio con fondos propios el cual consiste en la compra venta de cosméticos como: shampoo, perfumes, cremas, lápiz de ojos, lápiz labial, crema hidratantes, rubor, mascarillas y también vende variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos por encargos, también vende gaseosas y recargas de celulares,  sus compras son al contado en chinandega y vende de forma ambulante, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal y quincenal lo invertido, ella inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano ofreciendo su mercadería tiene clientes fijos y eventuales,uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su vivienda y de esa manera brindarles un lugar seguro y digno a sus hijos, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de cosméticos , recargas y gaseosas para cubrir la demanda de clientes que tiene
texts.en: Luisa Emilia, an adult, is accompanied by two minor sons under her responsibility, who are now in school. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, a place which is located in the western zone of the country. In her free time she likes to have fun with her family on family outing. She is characterized as a hard working, responsible woman with strong desires for self-improvement; because of economic difficulties she could not finish her studies, as she started her business from a young age to help with family expenses. Thanks to her spirit and desire to do well she is starting to build equity in her business, which consists of selling cosmetics such as shampoo, perfumes, creams, eyeliner, lipstick, hydrating cream, blush, and mascara; also, she sells various styles of clothing, shoes to order, soda, and cell phone batteries. Her purchases are cash in Chinandega and sold on foot; her sales are cash and credit collected weekly and fortnightly. She starts her work day very early offering her merchandise, and she has fixed clients. Eventually, one of her dreams is to be able to improve her living situation and in this manner establish a secure and dignified place for her boys. The objective of this loan is to invest in business capital in the purchase of cosmetics, batteries, and soda to keep up with the demand of the clients she has.

loans.use: to build work capital and invest in the purchase of cosmetics, batteries, and soda among other things

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, con abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería, posee cuatro reses de su propiedad, con dos Has. de inverna pasto natural de la zona, su esposa le apoya ordeñando la una vaca que tiene para ofrecer la leche y queso fresco a los moradores de su comunidad, Fernando ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una torete para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio y una segunda parte para el pago del veterinario que revisa su ganando.
texts.en:
Fernando is 32, lives with his wife and children in the district of Santo Tomás, a community of varied climate with abundant vegetation. Its population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Cutervo Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region, northern sierra of Peru.

He works in cattle raising, he has four cattle that he owns, with two hectares of natural grass wintering areas. His wife helps him milk a cow he has to offer milk and fresh cheese to the dwellers of his community. Fernando has applied for an loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of a young bull to later offer it at a better price and, secondly, to pay the veterinarian who checks his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a young bull to later offer it at a better price.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en:
Vimbai is a 22–year-old single woman residing in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers at local schools offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the last year, she has been running a poultry business, producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 when her family began facing financial difficulties.  
Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. 

Vimbai would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major super markets such as Food World in Zimbabwe. Vimbai will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With the increased profits, Vimbai hopes to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Manika is a 29-year-old married woman. She stays with her husband and her two children in a small town of Dhupguri. None of them receives an education due to lack of money.

Manika is a housewife, and her husband is a cycle van puller, but he does not have his own cycle van. 

Now they decided to buy a cycle van of their own. Like a rickshaw and auto, a cycle van is also one kind of transportation that carries people from one place to another, especially in remote areas.  

Manika hopes their financial condition will improve from the earlier situation with this new cycle van. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle van for transport purposes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a business woman who is very hardworking. She is married with five children who are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad, es una señora muy eficiente y muy trabajadora ya que cultiva sus granos básicos con ayuda en mano de obra. Actualmente vive con su hija de 28 años y su nieto de 4 años de edad que aun no estudia.
María cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijol, utilizando mano de obra para realizar las actividades agrícolas que demanda el cultivo, además se ocupa de los oficios domésticos en el hogar.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a María, para que pueda terminar de construir una cocina, ya que el dinero que había presupuestado para la construcción no le alcanzó.
Ella sueña con seguir con su negocio de granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia y además quiere que sus nietos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
María, 57, is a very efficient and very hardworking woman since she grows her basic grains with labor help. Currently, she lives with her daughter, 28, and her grandson who is 4 but doesn't study yet.

María grows basic grains like corn and beans, using labor to carry out the agricultural activities that the crops demand. Additionally, she occupies herself with the domestic work in the home.

With the loan, you will be helping María, so that she can finish constructing a kitchen, since the money that had been budgeted for the construction wasn't enough. 

She dreams of continuing her business of basic grains for feeding her family and, additionally, wants her grandchildren to have a good education.

loans.use: to be able to finish building a kitchen.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Bushra’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Bushra has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires and buckets of paints for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and buckets of paints

loans.name: Wualther Jose

texts.es:
Wualter tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito de independencia y desde hace 14 años trabaja muy duro para salir adelante en su negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar; pequeño negocio que le ha permitido poder tener los ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.

Wualter esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su engocio como manteles, platos, adornos para el hogar, entre otros y así poder atender los pedidos de sus clientes y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Wualter is 55, he lives in the district of Independencia and for the last 14 years, he has worked really hard to get ahead in his business selling home goods. It is a small business that has allowed him to be able to have the income to get his family ahead.

Wualter is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have been providing him, he will be able to buy merchandise for his business like tablecloths, plates, decorations for the home, among others. Thus, he will be able to fulfill the orders of his customers and, in this manner, be able to improve his income and continue fighting to be able to make his great dream a reality: "Have his own place of business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kortimi

texts.fr:
Mme Kortimi est âgée de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, elle a un statut de mariage polygame et vit chez son mari dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Elle exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de Bazin, Charbon de bois et elle est Teinturière depuis plus de 20 ans. Ces activités lui procure assez de revenus, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat des Bazin, Charbon de bois, et les produits nécessaires pour la teinture (Gala). Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à la maison et au marché à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Kortimi compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Elle compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kortimi is 60 years old and married with eight children. She is in a polygamous marriage and lives with her husband in the Koko quarter in the Koutiala prefecture, Sikasso region. She has various commercial activities based on the sale of traditional Bazin fabric, charcoal, and she has also been a dyer for more than 20 years. Her activities bring in adequate income, and she is well known as she receives a lot of customers. To satisfy her clientele and reinforce her business, this lady now collaborates with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is her first loan request. She will use this loan to buy Bazins, charcoal, and the products necessary for dying (Gala). She buys her stock in Koutiala and sells her produce at home and at the market to a mixed clientele for cash.
With the enlargement of her business, Kortimi plans to make a monthly profit of 120 000 FCFA that she will use to reimburse the interests to Soro, meet her own personal needs and invest the remainder in her business.
She is counting on the funding from Soro to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is married with five school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sunday has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer is an agronomist from Aramus village. She is a teacher by profession, working at a local village school. Varditer is a divorced woman with two sons (ages 16 and 17 years old). 

Besides teaching, Varditer is also involved in agriculture. She keeps a livestock of eight cows and is engaged in some limited land cultivation. Varditer uses the gathered milk in dairy production and sells the gathered products to local wholesalers. 

Varditer is a hardworking woman who does her best to sustain her sons' living. She has applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase three more cows and enlarge the dairy production. She will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Jose Wilder

texts.es:
Jose Wilder tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, con abundante vegetación, con relieve accidentado, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, también se desempeña como chofer de un camión de su distrito, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un torete para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Wilder is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Santo Tomás district, located in Cutervo Province, part of Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this community with a variable climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Jose works raising and selling cattle. He also works as a truck driver in his district. He is an enterprising father. He has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy a young bull which he will later sell at a profit and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a young bull to later resell it at a profit.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a 19-year-old businesswoman and a single mother of one. She currently resides in Nkayi district of Zimbabwe where she runs a small stand selling clothes and footwear. Marian has been successfully operating her business for over eight months. In her spare time, Marian volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, providing life skills education to local schoolchildren. 

With this Kiva loan, Marian will increase her inventory. Marian dreams of one day buying a boutique at the local business center. Profits from the business will enable her to further her education as well as provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 33-year-old businesswoman who is married and has two children. She lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. Unable to find a job, Roseline decided to start a poultry project to earn a living. She is  proud of how far she has come and would love to turn her small poultry project into a thriving business. 

Roseline volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working to keep children in school by teaching them valuable life skills. With the requested Kiva loan, she will buy more chicks so as to boost her sales while also providing her community with chicken and eggs. The additional profits will also allow Roseline to expand her business, assist the needy and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Mi Cajero Group

texts.es: El grupo “MI CAJERO” está conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista a y prestar servicios. Alina tiene 62 años es soltera con 02 hijos independientes. Ella implemento su restaurant en su vivienda en el cual trabaja todos los días. Y a  la vez da en alquiler su mototaxi hace varios meses el cual le genera un ingreso económico extra. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios  nuevos ollas platos tazas y cubiertos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su restaurant para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Alina es la segunda persona del lado derecho viste polo fucsia.
texts.en:
The group "Mi Cajero" is made up of members who work in retail and offer services. Alina is 62; she is single with 2 independent children. She started her restaurant in her home, where she works every day. Several months ago, she started renting out her mototaxi occasionally, which generates extra economic income.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of new utensils, pots, plates, cups and silverware. Her great desire is to grow her restaurant, to provide better attention to her customers. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Alina is the second person on the right side dressed in a fuchsia shirt.

loans.use: to buy pots, plates, cups and silverware.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi âgée de 33ans, Afi coiffeuse et revendeuse de profession exerce son activité à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 13 et 10ans. Pour assurer le bien - être de son activité, elle sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des mèches et des produits de beauté. Elle espère réinvestir dans son activité et assurer l'avenir de toute la famille.
texts.en: Afi is 33 years old. She is a hairdresser and reseller who works in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children who are 10 and 13 years old. To ensure the well-being of her business, she is asking for her second loan in order to buy hair extensions and beauty products. She would like to reinvest in her business and secure the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past three years, Chizi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and to pay for transportation to her place of operation.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and to pay for transportation to her place of operation.

loans.name: Grecia Daniela

texts.es:
Grecia, tiene 26 años de edad, ella vive en la calurosa ciudad de Pucallpa, junto a su linda familia. 
Laura es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella viene trabajando más de 2 años como asistente administrativa.

Laura esta, muy agradecida con los prestatarios KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y accesorios y de esta manera obtener más ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.

El sueño de Laura es lograr tener su tienda de venta de ropa y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Grecia is 26. She lives in the hot city of Pucallpa, with her beautiful family. Laura is a very hardworking and responsible person; she has been working as an administrative assistant for more than two years. Laura is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since she will invest the money in the purchase of clothing and accessories. In this manner, she will obtain more income and provide a better quality of life to her family. Her main customers are her neighbors and coworkers.

Laura's dream is to achieve having her clothing store and therefore obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stocks of household consumables:  wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables: wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Es una señora cordial, viuda, tiene 72 años de edad, tiene 10 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes. Con el objetivo que su negocio crezca, solicita su  tercer financiamiento para comprar mercadería: chivería, gaseosas, granos básicos, máquinas de afeitar, pastes para lavar trastes, jabón de baños, de ropa y para lavar trastes. Desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña pulpería con los ingresos percibidos de su jubilación. Con las ganancias percibidas le han permitido viajar frecuentemente a Managua para realizarse chequeos médicos, debido a que se encuentra un poco delicada de salud por problemas de artritis. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Vilma is a cordial 72 year-old widow.  She has ten children who are all grown and independent.  With the aim of helping her business grow, she is asking for a third loan in order to purchase the following merchandise: Chivería brand products, soft drinks, basic grains, electric shavers, dish soap, bathrooms soaps, and detergent for laundry. She established her business two years ago as a small corner store with the income that she received from her retirement.  With her earnings she has traveled frequently to Managua for medical checkups, since her health is a bit delicate as she has arthritis.  Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase Chivería brand products, soft drinks, basic grains, electric shavers, dish soap, bathrooms soaps, and detergent for laundry.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene 66 años, ella no logro sacar su estudios debido a que sus padres no tenia los recursos necesarios para brindarles una educación, ella esta casada tiene 5 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y ya no viven con ella su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura. 

Candelaria  inicio en la agricultura a la edad de 18 años,  trabajo que lo realizo junto con su esposo para darle la alimentación y educación a sus hijo hoy en día lo realiza para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y alimentación de ella y su esposo.

El crédito lo utilizara para invertir en la compra de ganado de repasto para engordarlos y cuando ya estén gordos venderán una parte del ganado para cancelar el crédito que a sacado con CREDICAMPO y con la ganancia que le quede ella y su esposo tendrán un poco de ingresos para su alimentación y otros gastos que se le puedan presentar.

El sueño de Candelaria es tener un buen bienestar en su vejez y poder ayudarles un poco a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 66 years old; she didn't complete her studies because her parents didn't have the necessary resources to give her an education. She is married and has 5 children who are grown up and no longer live with her. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Candelaria started to work in agriculture at 18 years of age, work that she carried out along with her husband to provide food and education for their children. Nowadays, she works to help her husband with the household expenses and for their food.

She will use the loan to invest in buying grazing cattle to fatten up and when they are fattened she will sell a portion of the cattle to pay back the loan that she took with CREDICAMPO. With her remaining earnings she and her husband will have a little bit of income for their food and any other expense that could come up.

Candelaria’s dream is to have a good home in her old age and to be able to help her children and grandchildren a little bit.

loans.use: to buy cattle for grazing

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Mariée mère de six enfants, Mamou est âgée de 41 ans et vit  avec son époux et ses enfants dans une grande famille à  Koutiala (région de Sikasso). Pour des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer sur les études primaires, pour cela elle s’est basée sur les activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se lancée  dans la vente de tubercules il y a 11ans. Mamou  trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de  faire recours    l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de 9 ans.  Après avoir pris des prêts en solidaire (prêt de groupe)  tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 15ème prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs de pommes de terre et des sacs d’ignames à Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente à Koutiala  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités. 
Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Mamou is married and the mother of six children. She is 41 years old and lives with her spouse and children in Koutiala (Sikasso region). For social reasons, she did not finish primary school. For that reason, from a young age, she started working on revenue-generating activites with her mother.

After having tried a number of businesses without success, she finally began selling tubers 11 years ago. Mamou finds that this business helps her earn enough money.

In order to satisfy her clients, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso nine years ago.  After having taken group loans (all repaid), this is her 15th individual loan (all previous loans repaid). 

With this loan, she would like to buy potatoes and yams in Sikasso. She sells in Koutiala to men and women for cash. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA that she would like to use to reimburse the interest from Soro, to help out with the daily family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business. 

She counts on the financing from Soro Yiriwaso to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a sus 02 hijos los cuales son independientes económicamente y por el contrario aportan a la economía del hogar, vive en el caserío El Tomate, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, que pertenece a la Provincia de Jaén, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y quesillos, sus clientes en la mayoría son los moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para arreglar el local de su negocio y de esta manera tener un ambiente agradable para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and lives in the village of El Tomate, in a rural part of Pucará district, Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in the North Andes of Peru. She lives in her own house built of rustic materials with her two children who are financially economic and help with the household expenses.

Francisca sells pork and cheese. the majority of her clients are locals. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN to remodel her shop and in this way create an agreeable atmosphere in which to sell her products.

loans.use: to remodel her shop to improve it's ambient.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli lives in Arevashat village with her parents-in-law and three-year-old son. Together with her in-laws, Nelli is involved in agriculture. They cultivate potatoes, tomatoes and greens in the greenhouse and also keep one cow. They earn income by selling the harvest at local open markets. Nelli also milks the cow and uses the milk in cheese production, but it is for family use only. 

Nelli has now applied for this loan to improve her farm. The loan of 3,000 USD will greatly support her to renovate the greenhouse and purchase a polyethylene cover for it. As the new cultivation period has already started, it is very important for Nelli to make these improvements and increase her income from agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse and purchase a polyethylene cover for it

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 38-year-old married woman who, for the past 2 years has had a business of selling milk with her husband, who is shown in the picture. She has 1 milk cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

She has 2 daughters and 2 sons, who are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life and happily runs and supports it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase her production capacity, which would ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves

loans.name: Mesias

texts.es:
Mesias tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú que se utiliza en días festivos, como antiséptico, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos para su trapiche que le permita una mejor destilación y de esta manera ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mesias is 26 years old and lives with his wife and children in Callayuc district, located in the Province of Cutervo part of Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this community work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Mesias work distilling aguardiente, a traditional drink in the mountains of Peru, which is used on festival days as an antiseptic. He has requested a loan of 2,500 PEN to buy spare parts for his still and in this way offer a greater quantity to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his still to allow better distillation.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is a 25-year-old single mother of one, living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Chipo works with schools in her community and helps students gain life and study skills. Chipo started her own poultry business when her family started facing financial difficulties. Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 250 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. Chipo has also managed to employ two people who were previously struggling to find work.

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Chipo would very much like to increase her production capacity. Therefore, she will use the Kiva loan to expand the fowl run (an enclosed yard for keeping poultry) purchase more chick feed, broiler feed concentrate, and fencing in order to increase production. With more business, Chipo hopes to improve the standard of living for her and her child as well as create employment in her community.

loans.use: to expand the fowl run and purchase more chick feed, broiler feed concentrate and fencing.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is from Aragats village where she lives with her two sons, daughter-in-law and small grandchildren. Rima and her family members are running a farm. It includes a greenhouse where they cultivate potatoes, cucumbers, and greens. Near the house where they live, Rima and her husband also run a small store where they trade different food items. The agribusiness is a very important source of income for this family so Rima applied for this loan. She asks for this loan of 2,000 USD to be able to purchase materials (polyethylene cover and wires) and renovate the greenhouse.
 
As this is Rima's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for greenhouse renovation (polyethylene cover, wires) and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: German Agustin

texts.es:
Germán Agustín tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta de animales menores pavos, patos, cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Germán Agustín is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Cayalti District, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people in this community with a varied climate work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Together with his wife he raises small animals like ducks, turkeys and pigs. His business is located behind his house. He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals. In this way he will be able to generate more revenues for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Haji

texts.en:
Haji is married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He has seven children, one of whom is in school and the rest are adults. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past four years, Haji has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transportation business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites that the high cost of maintenance is his major challenge. 

With the loan he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marleny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 43 años, esta acompañada, solo estudio hasta tercer grado. Su compañero de vida se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad de estos solamente dos viven con ella. Ambos hijos trabajan para ayudar en los gastos de sus casa. 

Marleny se dedica a la agricultura junto con cu compañero de vida, ella aprendió este trabajo desde muy pequeña ya que observaba como trabajaban sus padres, a ella le gusto mucho esta actividad porque a sido la fuente de la cuál le a dado la educación básica a sus hijos y de la cual tiene algo de ingresos a su casa. La distancia que recorre desde su casa al lugar donde tiene el cultivo es muy poca solamente recorren un kilómetro de distancia

EL préstamo lo invertirá para la siembra y cultivo de maíz para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pesticida para el cultivo y para  pagar el alquiler del terreno

Ella sueña con poder tener su propio terreno para trabajar y poder cancelar los créditos que adquiere con CREDICAMPO y poder tener una mejor condición de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 43 years old, and she is in a relationship. She has only studied up to third grade. Her life companion works in agriculture. She has 3 children who are now grown; and of these, only two live with her. Both of her children work in order to help with the household expenses.

Marleny works in agriculture along with her life companion. She learned this occupation when she was very young, as she used to observe the way that her parents worked. She likes this occupation very much, because it has been the means by which she has been able to provide her children with a basic education, and it is a source of income for her home. The distance that she travels from her house to the place where she has her crop is very short, only about a kilometer.

She will invest the loan in planting and growing corn and in purchasing compost, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for the crop, and in paying to rent the land.

She dreams of being able to have her own land to cultivate, paying off the loans that she is getting with CrediCampo, and being able to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost, and fertilizer, and to rent the land.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
This is Dama, a very hardworking woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She appreciates Kiva lenders' financial support in her previous loan. Besides the fish selling business, Dama operates a retail shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bitter balls, oil, peppers, rice, dry bush meat and  fish for her cook shop (restaurant).

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in Tiribe, a coastal region in Kenya. She is a very hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has been preparing food and selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the loan, Asha wants to purchase tea leaves, beans, tomatoes, rice, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, sugar and onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, beans, tomatoes, rice, salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, sugar and onions for her business.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Shaghap village in the Ararat region of Armeinia. She lives there with her husband and two sons (3 and 7 years old). The family is in the farming business. They run a farm which includes raising cattle, calves, and chickens, as well as cultivating wheat, barley, and corn. Narine herself also grows peach, apricot, pear and apples trees with great love and care.
The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a big support for this hardworking couple to make some improvements on their farm. Particularly, they plan to purchase fertilizer, renovate the barn, and buy forage for the livestock. 
As this is Narine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, barn renovation, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soup, paper tissues, toothpaste, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt, peppers, rice, oil, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her posho mill grinding business and earn a higher income that she used to improve her living standards.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu for her business

loans.name: Verun

texts.en:
Verun is from the Ararat region of Armenia. She has been a farmer for over 10 years. Verun doesn’t have her own land; she rents one hectare of land near the house where she lives with her husband and two sons (8 and 4 years old). 
Verun has now requested this loan of USD 2,500 to be able to invest in her farm. The loan will greatly assist her to purchase an ox, hire workers for land cultivation, and purchase fertilizer. As this is Verun's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, hire workers for land cultivation, and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one who is underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Judith has operated a cereal and grain shop at the market for the past two years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts and lentils for her business.

loans.name: Debora Scarleth

texts.es: Debora Scarleth, 27 años de edad, acompañada con hijo menor de edad, es originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por el comercio, turismo por sus hermosas playas, ubicado en el occidente del país, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar escuchar música junto con su pequeño bebe,salir al parque, entre otras cosas mas,hoy en día uno de sus sueños y meta es poder ver formado a su pequeño hijo en profesional y el brindarle un mejor futuro, Debora es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de su propio negocio, venta de mercadería en general como:productos para bebes como: baberos, edredones de cuna, juegos de sabana de cuna, lava pachas, ropa de bebe, mosquitero para cuna, protector de cuna, bolsos para bebe, mantillas, pachas, blusas, pantalones, short, cosméticos, zapatos entre otros, sus compras las realiza en mercado de mayoreos en otras localidad, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano de forma ambulante, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal y quincenal lo invertido,. El objetivo este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de variedades estilos de ropa tanto para bebes, niños, damas, caballeros entre otros para cubrir varios pedidos que tiene y para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Debora Scarleth is 27 years old and has a partner and one son. Debora is originally from one of the municipalities of the Chinandega area of the country, known for its trade sector and tourism, with its beautiful beaches. Chinandega is in the west of Nicaragua. In her free time, Debora likes to listen to music with her little baby, head out to the park or do other things. One of Debora's goals and dreams is to see her son have a profession and to offer him a better future. Debora owns and runs her own small business. She sells merchandise for babies, such as bibs, blankets for cribs, bottles, baby clothes, mosquito nets for cribs, crib protectors, bags for babies, blouses, trousers, shorts, cosmetics, shoes and other goods. Debora buys her goods from the wholesale markets in other towns. She has regular customers, and business from passers-by. Debora starts her day very early in the morning as a street vendor. She sells in cash and on credit, collecting payments weekly and fortnightly. This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up her business by buying different clothes for babies, children, women, men and others. She is buying these goods in order to fulfill customers' orders. In the not-too-distant future, Debora hopes that this loan will help her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business by buying different clothes for babies, children and young adults.

loans.name: Jeimmy Katherine

texts.es:
Mi nombre es  Jeimmy Katherine  tiene 19 años de edad, vive con los padres y el hermano, el padre trabaja en una ladrillera, la mama es ama de casa y el hermano trabaja por días, el mayor sueño  desde niña fue poder salir adelanté tener un trabajo estable, estudiar una carrera, ser la mejor para así poder ayudar a los padres económica mente, la primaria fue un mayor esfuerzo para los padres y a la ves una felicidad para ellos en especial para poder lograr lo que ellos nunca pudieron lograr, así fueron trascurriendo los años asta que ella estaba cursando  noveno grado, casi que no lo logra, fue una tristeza muy grande para ellos, pero con ayuda de los compañeros y la de los maestros lo logro, para ella fue una alegría muy grande poder graduarse con los compañeros, poder darles una alegría a los padres y a al hermano, ya que contaba con el apoyo de la familia, compañeros, profesores y así poder cursar décimo,  para el grado once  fue como un sueño para ella nunca pensó que pudiera llegar hasta allá. 
Ella sabía que tenía que seguir el rumbo  y era poder cumplir el gran sueño en el cual hoy  en día tuvo una oportunidad de estudiar, la cual le brinda la corporación de CAMPO ALTO  donde esta aprovechando al, 100% ya que es un sueño hecho realidad.

En el cual en este momento esta cursando 3 tercer semestre de AIPI y a los padres no les alcanza el presupuesto para poder ayudarla a terminar el estudio.
texts.en:
This is Jeimmy Katherine. She is 19 years old and lives with her parents and brother. Her father works at a brick factory, while her mother is a housewife; Jeimmy's brother works part-time.Since she was a girl, Jeimmy's biggest dream has been to prosper and to have a stable job and study at university. She wants to be the best she can so that she can help her parents financially. Primary school was both a huge effort and a source of great happiness for Jeimmy's parents. Jeimmy achieved things that they could never do. The years went by and, in ninth grade, Jeimmy almost failed. This was very sad for them but, with the help of friends and teachers, Jeimmy did it.
