She was very happy to graduate from high school with her classmates and make her parents and brother so happy. Jeimmy had the support of her family, classmates and teachers and so could study tenth. She also studied eleventh grade, which was a dream for her as she never thought she would achieve this.

Jeimmy knew that she had to keep following her path and she would be able to achieve her great dream and now how the opportunity to study. Jeimmy is being offered the chance to study by "Campo Alto" and is taking full advantage of the opportunity as this is a dream come true.

Jeimmy is currently in third semester studying AIPI. Her parents cannot afford to help her to finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for one semester.

loans.name: Yerlin José

texts.es:
Yerlin José es un joven de 29 años originario del municipio de El Sauce.
Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad para una empresa de la localidad donde tiene varios años de laborar.
Como todo joven que sueña con formar su familia hace pocos meses se casó con una joven de su mismo pueblo con la cual tiene un futuro por delante y sueños que compartir.
Es un joven muy responsable en su trabajo y en su hogar, ya que con los préstamos que le ha otorgado los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel ayudó a su madre a mejorar un poco las condiciones de la casa.
En este momento Yerlin está necesitando un pequeño financiamiento para compra de medicamentos con el fin de mejorar la salud de su esposa.
Con la fé en Dios espera que estas personas de buen corazón sigan apoyando sus necesidades donde les agradece con el alma.
texts.en:
Yerlin José is a 29-year-old youth originally from the El Sauce municipality. He works as a security guard for a local business where he has worked for many years.

As a young man who dreams of starting a family, a few months ago he married a young woman from the same village with whom he has a future ahead and dreams to share.

He is a very responsible young man in his work and his home since with the loans that have been awarded to him by the Kiva lenders through Ceprodel, he helped his mother to improve the conditions of their home a bit.

At this time, Yerlin needs a small loan to purchase medicine to improve the health of his wife. With faith in God, he hopes that these good-hearted people continue supporting his needs, and he gives them thanks with all of his being.

loans.use: to purchase medicine.

loans.name: Mulunga

texts.en:
Mulunga is a married woman with four school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been selling cows at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

Mulunga joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cows for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for her business.

loans.name: Ruly Katty

texts.es:
Ruly es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con  mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de educación y trabaja como auxiliar en un colegio inicial de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y enseña alrededor de 25 niños, a quienes quiere mucho y es por ello que cree que le va bien en su trabajo, porque tiene mucha paciencia con los niños.

Ruly esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar un terreno lo cual le permitirá poder tener una casa propia; así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Ruly is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. With this desire and a lot of effort, Ruly was able to study education at university and works as a classroom helper in one of the city's primary schools. Ruly works around eight hours per day, teaching some 25 children whom she loves very much. She thinks she is doing well at her job because she is very patient with the children.

Ruly is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy a plot of land, allowing her to have her own house. Ruly will continue to fight to make her dream - of building her own house - a reality.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has nine children, all of whom are adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a coconut selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Sihle

texts.en:
Sihle is a 29-year-old business woman living in Nkayi District, Zimbabwe. She is married with two children. Passionate about protecting the environment, Sihle volunteers at local clinics and organizes cleaning campaigns. She also volunteers her time offering psychosocial support to young people in her community to ensure that they stay in school. For over a year, Sihle has been renting a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. 

With the Kiva loan, Sihle will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts to increase the amount of items she can sell. Sihle dreams of growing her business enough to one day open her own shop. The profits from her business will allow Sihle to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 37-year-old mother of five who lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. She operates her own shop where she sells groceries like sugar, flour, washing soap, coffee creamers, kapenta (sardines) and mahewu (a fermented drink made from finger millet malt). Judith first started her business when she divorced her husband and was left to care for her five children on her own. Judith is also an active volunteer in her town where she delivers health sessions in local schools and throughout the local community. She is now a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches children life and education skills.  

With this Kiva loan, Judith will add more shelves in her store and increase her inventory of groceries such as soap, sugar, bread, drinks, bread and flour. Profits from the business will be used to put her children through school as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Javier Aldo

texts.es:
Javier vive en la ciudad de Ica, se dedica a su trabajo como albañil desde hace un año. Con este humilde trabajo javier puede tener ingresos para para poder salir adelante y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que es padre de un hijo ded 8 y 19 años de edad.

Javier esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos y de esta manera poder enviarlos a la escuela con los materiales necesarios; así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos y tener una empresa constructora”.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the city of Ica. He has been making a living as a builder for a year. This humble job gives Javier an income in order to get ahead and cover household costs. Javier has a 19-year-old son, and an eight-year-old son.

Javier is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they are providing, he will be able to buy school materials for his children, and can send them to school with the necessary supplies. Javier will continue to work in order to realise his dream of giving his children a good up-bringing and good quality of life, and of having his own construction business.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 22 years old and lives in the rural Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development because she believes that they have a chance in life when they make informed choices. Noreen is currently operating her own poultry business which she loves very much and would like expand it.

This Kiva loan will allow Noreen to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks in order to increase production and boost sales. Increased profits will enable Noreen to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks

loans.name: Munkuli

texts.en:
Munkuli is a 20-year-old young woman residing in Binga, a district in Zimbabwe. She is single and lives with her parents. She has been successfully operating a store for the past five months selling kapenta (a small fish). Munkuli started this business because she wanted to be economically independent and assist her parents and family. When she is not working in her store, Munkuli serves as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network in her community where she does home visits in order to assist vulnerable children.

With the requested Kiva loan, she will build her own shop instead of paying rent in order to cut business costs. She will also use part of the loan to purchase kapenta fish in bulk. With increased business profits, Munkuli will be able to further her education as well as support her family.

loans.use: To purchase kapenta fish in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, salt, sugar, washing soap, and sanitary pads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, dried meat, fish, pepper, rice, oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nateete B in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Jane has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities such as sugar. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essentials for the shop like sugar, milk and other items for sale, and will help Jane to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger retail shop. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essentials for the shop like sugar, milk and others items for sale.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widowed woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, beans and sells to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more goats for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more goats for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in a village called Aratashen of the Armavir region. She is a teacher at the local school.

Mariam is a mother of three children. Her elder daughter works at the same school together with Mariam, while her son is of school age and her middle daughter Gayane studies at university. The family also includes Mariam's husband and her mother-in-law. 

The education of their children is very important to Mariam and her husband. She does her best to provide better living conditions for them. 

This loan is also very important for Mariam and her family. They are asking for the loan to be able to cover Gayane's university tuition. Please help Mariam's daughter to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Gayane's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods for her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Petron

texts.en:
Petron is a 20-year-old single woman residing in Nkayi District in Zimbabwe. She currently operates a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes and handbags. She has been running the business for three months and is really pleased with how far she has come in such a short time. In her free time, Petron volunteers as a member of Cama, a network of Camfed alumnae who strive to keep children in school. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Petron will increase her inventory of clothing and handbags. With the profits, Petron will fund and continue her education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and handbags.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 26-year-old married woman. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive much education. Now Maya is a mother of one child who is too small to go to school. 

Maya’s husband is a mason by profession but his income is scanty, as it’s a season-based work. Sometimes he has to sit idle. Maya decided to help her husband financially.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can start her dairy business. She will sell milk and milk products in the local market and in her neighborhood. She hopes she will get a high profit from this business, as demand for dairy products is high in her area. She thanks BJS and Kiva greatly for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk & milk products.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is a 32-year-old single mother of one who lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. For over two years she has been operating her own poultry business. She specializes in rearing Rhodes Island chickens which she sells to local residents in her community. Loveness serves as the area chairperson of Cama, a network of Camfed alumnae who reinvest in their communities through volunteer work. When she is not working, Loveness actively volunteers in community clean up campaigns and serves as a Camfed Learner Guide by teaching local schoolchildren life and education skills. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Loveness will build a bigger and up-to-standard poultry enclosure in order to increase the number of chickens she sells. Loveness will also purchase broiler chicks so as to diversify her offerings and attract a broader range of customers. She hopes to become the biggest supplier of eggs and chicken cuts in Nkayi. An increase in profits would also mean that she will be in a better position to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To build a poultry enclosure.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Dzame has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past year, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mbodze sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Nayantara

texts.en:
Nayantara is a 28-year-old married woman. She is illiterate but can sign her name while her husband is totally illiterate and cannot even sign his name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive more education. Now Nayantara is a mother of three children and they all go to school. 

She is engaged in animal husbandry. Now she wants to buy a dairy cow. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is running a small fish business. Both Nayantara and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children, a future that is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream true. Now, Nayantara lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but in the future, she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement) with her business profit. Nayantara and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken on the market for selling milk products and fish by fulfilling the local market demand.

Nayantara is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tissues, flour, sweets, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the kiosk shop business, Mwaka sells juice and drinking water.

She is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Nomathemba

texts.en:
Nomathemba is a 23-year-old entrepreneur. She is single and lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe with her parents. For the last seven months, Nomathemba has been running a flea market business where she sells clothing such as t-shirts, jewellery, shoes and dresses. She is passionate about Cama, a network of Camfed graduates who reinvest in their communities by holding education and health campaigns. Nomathemba serves as a Cama area chairperson and loves helping her community. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, a network of women dedicated to keeping children in school. She does this at the nearest secondary school in her community. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Nomathemba wants to increase and diversify her inventory of clothes, shoes and handbags so as to attract a broader clientele. With increased revenue, Nomathemba will pursue higher education and fulfill her dream of being a nurse.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her stock.

loans.name: Maa Baulei Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Baulei Self Help Group consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed this group to help share their problems and to solve their problems themselves.

One of the members is Nirupama who was selected as the president of Maa Baulei Shg. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Nirupama. Nirupama is 44 years old and is staying with her husband and her four children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 100,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fabric and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, oil and coal for her business.

loans.name: Jeffry Lorena

texts.es: Es una joven emprendedora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 27 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años respectivamente, el mayor cursa su tercer grado de primaria. Con el objetivo de ampliar su negocio solicita su segundo financiamiento para construir de concreto el local de su panadería. Desde hace 6 años estableció con fondos propios el negocio de elaboración de pan, repostería y venta de refrescos naturales. Con la diversificación de los productos que ofrece: Pizza, pan de coco, pan bond dulce, empanadas, picos, queque de harina, queque de banano, sodacake (pan costeño de dos variedades, dulce y con jengibre), pudines y pasteles. Le han permitido crear fuentes de empleo al contratar a un ayudante cuyo salario mensual es de C$ 3,600, gracias a las ganancias percibidas hace un mes ha establecido un nuevo negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicletas y contar un banner de publicidad de los productos que ofrece. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer el servicio de cafetería.
texts.en:
This is an enterprising young woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 27 years old, and she is a single mother with two children, ages 7 and 3 years, respectively. Her oldest is studying in the third grade of primary school. 

With the goal of expanding her business, she is seeking her second loan, in order to build her bakery shop from cement. Six years ago she opened her business using her own funds; baking bread and pastries, and selling natural soft drinks.  She offers a wide variety of products: pizza, coconut bread, sweet bread, empanadas, picos (traditional Nicaraguan pastries), flour cake, banana cake, soda cake (two coastal varieties—sweet and ginger), puddings, and cakes. 

She has been able to create employment, hiring an assistant whose monthly salary is C$3,600 (córdobas). Thanks to her earnings, she has been able to open a new business, selling replacement parts for bicycles, and she has a sign advertising her products. 

Her dream is to expand her business and offer coffee service.

loans.use: to build her bakery shop out of concrete.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is a 43-year-old married woman and her husband is 49 years old. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. They have two children. One of her children is in class IX (grade 9) and the other one has completed her education up to grade 10.  Radhika lives in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri District.

Radhika’s husband cultivates different crops in different seasons and sells them in the market. Now she and her husband decided to cultivate wheat. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for wheat cultivation. Radhika’s dream is to purchase more farmland in the future with the profit from her business.

She is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for wheat cultivation.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is 26 years old and married. She is a mother of one child who receives an education. Both Sandhya and her husband have completed their education up to grade 6 & 7, respectively. 

She is a housewife. Her husband is 37 years old and runs a small tea stall. Her husband prepares tea and sells it to the local people who come to his stall. There is great demand for tea in her area all during the day but they cannot meet their family expenses with this income. For this reason, Sandhya decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can renovate and maintain their shop properly and earn more money. She hopes she can also purchase snack items such as biscuits, cakes, breads etc. with her delicious tea with the profit from the business. She dreams of enlarging the tea stall in the future. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To renovate and maintain her husband’s  tea stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 35-year-old widow living in Nkayi, a rural district in Zimbabwe. As a single mother of two, she is the sole breadwinner in her family. Charity currently runs a poultry business which she started in 2010. She mainly specializes in the rearing of laying hens for egg production. She sells eggs at the local market and to residents in her community. Her children assist her with the running of the poultry business.
 
Charity will use the Kiva loan to purchase more laying hens to increase production of eggs. With increased production and profits, Chairty will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as improve her current standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more hens.

loans.name: Yinani

texts.en:
Yinani is 27 years old, married and a mother of one living in the Binga District of Zimbabwe. For over three years, she has been successfully operating a flea market that specializes in clothing for children, men and women. When she is not working on her stall, Yinani serves as a Cama member, an alumnae network of Camfed graduates in her community. As a Cama member, Yinani volunteers her time offering peer education and encouraging young girls to stay in school. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to offer a wider range of products. An increase in business would place her in a position to create employment that will benefit her entire community. This will also enable her to provide for her child and family.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is Martha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Ana Lucelly

texts.es: Ana es una madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en zona rural de otro departamento, en vista de la economía fluctuante de su región, ella tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de pizzas. Ana sueña con ampliar su negocio,  comprar un enfriador para vender gaseosas y ofrecer un servicio integral a su fiel clientela,  el dinero del crédito será invertido en el enfriador y los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de las pizzas (salsa, quesos, masas, etc), con el ideal de aumentar sus ventas no sólo en el negocio, sino prestar el servicio a domicilio, para generar mayores ingresos económicos y solventar la situación familiar en general.
texts.en: Ana is a single mother of 4 children who lives in a rural area in another department. Because of the fluctuating economy in her region, she has had the opportunity to start her own business selling pizzas. Ana dreams of expanding her business and buying a cooler to sell sodas to offer a more comprehensive service to her loyal customers. The loan money will be invested in the cooler and the necessary ingredients for the preparation of pizza (sauce, cheese, dough, etc.) with the idea to increase sales not only in her business but to also provide a delivery service to generate more income and improve her family situation in general.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler for refreshments and ingredients to make pizza

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu in order to have her business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, onions, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pastries, sweets, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar, chocolate, biscuits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that neither has nor electricity piped water. She is married with eight children, six in school and two adults

Mbeyu has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies (manure, sprinklers, pesticide, fertilizer)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, rice, toothpaste, oil, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is 34 years old and lives in Korisaya village of Deoghar district, Jharkhand, with her husband and three children. She owns a store consisting of fancy items and stationery, too. She sells bangles, vermilion, small mirrors, combs, children’s toys, clips, hair bands, etc. 

Komal has gained a lot of customers as she always has what they need which is high quality merchandise at an affordable price. She is requesting a loan of INR 15,000 to expand her business and buy items in bulk at a cheaper price. 

Komal’s husband is a painter; he paints walls, boards, hoardings etc. He is also looking for an alternative job as his income is not sufficient to run their household. Due to this, a lot more responsibility falls on Komal. 

Komal is an enterprising woman with great ambition to move ahead in life. She likes to be a winner and her biggest secret to success is persistence and dedication.

loans.use: to buy bangles, mirrors, combs, children’s toys, and hair clips in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and new equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, peppers, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, coal, salt, onions, rice, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Emapalado Ari Group

texts.es:
El grupo Empalado Ari está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son 20 mujeres que luchan por salir adelante y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza por medio de la cual podrán conocer la vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodora, quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, y comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Aunque su trabajo es muy sacrificado ella lo hace por poder ayudar a su familia, está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Empalado Ari group is in its second cycle of the committee program, where everyone is working and helping themselves to advance. They are 20 women who are striving to advance and are also doing the survey on eliminating poverty, through which they will be able to understand the life of each one and be able to work accordingly.

One of the members of Señora Teodora, who sells natural remedies. She comments that through her work she is helping her family. Although she works selflessly, she does it to be able to help her family. She is striving to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of natural remedies, since in this way she will be able to continue working and striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
El Eden se llama este grupo que está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo.
Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender, y también se dedica a la venta de frutas variadas. Por medio de sus trabajos ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, y aunque su trabajo es humilde lo hace para poder ayudar  a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, etc., y además quiere comprar frutas para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called the Eden group. They are in their second loan cycle of the committee program in which they all work and help one another to cope. All of them are actively involved in the activities proposed by the group and they help each other to reach the group's common goals.

Maria earns her living selling food that she prepares and then goes out to sell. She also sells assorted fruit. Through this work she can help her family and loved ones. Although her work is humble, it does help her family.

She has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for her food such as vegetables, meats, spices, and more. She also wants to buy fruits to sell. She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, spices, and fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Aseda Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Aseda and made up of two people who both live in the same area. The representative of the group, Margaret (who's standing on the right in the photo), is 41 years old and attended school until the secondary level. She has two children for whom she is still responsible.

Margaret has been selling tiles for six years in a shop at her residence in Dansoman. She procures her goods in a market in Ghana. She will need this loan to buy more tiles to sell to customers. 

In order to strengthen her business, Margaret, together with the other group member, is seeking her second loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy more tiles to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nilam

texts.en:
Nilam’s husband runs a grocery shop in Korisaya village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. Nilam is a housewife who also helps her husband in his business. Both work very hard and have been in this business for the past 12 years. Their grocery shop inventory consists of daily consumable products such as rice, pulses, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, nuts, ghee, grams, spices, etc. They earn approximately INR 10,000 per month. 

Nilam aims to improve this grocery store for which she is requesting a loan of INR 20,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. This is her second loan from the local NGO “MESP”. She invested the first loan also in the same shop and made good profit, repaying it successfully.

Nilam believes the more items displayed at the store, the better her sales will be. This additional income from the business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. 

Nilam hopes that her business continues to flourish and also that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries,and beverages

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, ella proviene de una Familia de agricultores donde sus padres, tienen plantación de caña de azúcar y hortalizas.
Se animó y con la ayuda de su familia se independizo hace 9  años y hoy ya tiene  su propio negocio y tiene venta de todo tipo de artículos, como ser licuadoras, colchones, sillones, y demás. Comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de licuadoras, colchones, sillones, para así seguir trabajando y luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and is a single mother with 3 children. She comes from a family of farmers who have planted sugarcane and vegetables. 
She was encouraged by her family to become independent. With their help, she has had her own business selling all kinds of items such as blenders, mattresses, chairs, and others for 9 years. She says she is doing very well in her location and she has already gained a very good clientele.
She has requested this loan to invest in buying blenders, mattresses, and couches, so she can keep working hard for her family.

loans.use: to purchase blenders, mattresses, couches, and more

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo que lleva por nombre “Las Mercedes”, es un grupo numeroso, que además de trabajar todas unidas, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Amelia, una mujer muy luchadora que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela y siempre recibe varios pedidos de trabajos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes, ya que de esa forma podrá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group goes by the name "Las Mercedes." It is a numerous group, which in addition to working with everyone united, is doing the survey on eliminating poverty. One of the members is Señora Amelia, a very hard-working woman who, with great sacrifice and effort, is making progress.

She is a seamstress, and she comments that through her work, she helps her family. She has acquired many customers, and she always receives a number of orders for work.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies to be able to continue to satisfy her customers, since in this way she will be able to continue improving her living conditions and those of her family. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies for dressmaking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like paper tissue, soap, and sardines for her business,

loans.name: La Bonanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama La Bonanza es un grupo nuevo que se formó a partir del interés de algunas de las señoras que ya había participado en comité. El grupo tiene 15 integrantes, todas con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades van haciendo.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy eficiente y responsable es la Sra. Elena quien se dedica a vender ropas tanto usadas como nuevas, ella sale por los barrios de Santaní a ofrecer sus productos, comenta que está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda la fundación.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Bonanza." It is a new group that was formed as a result of the interest of some of the women who had already participated in a committee. The group has 15 members. All are very hopeful about the activities they are carrying out.

One of the members who is known for being very efficient and responsible is Señora Elena, who sells clothing, used as well as new. She goes through the neighborhoods of Santani to offer her products. She comments that she is very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation offers her. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various articles of clothing to sell, since in this way she will be able to continue with her sales. All the women are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Ginna Alejandra

texts.es: Ginna tiene un hijo de 7 año, vive con su pareja, tiene experiencia en el gremio de la belleza cosmetológica; gracias a ello, desde hace 12 años tiene una peluquería en su casa, desempeñando su actividad con el apoyo de otra empleada. Ginna sueña con tener su propio local paran  continuar capacitándose cada día más y seguir ofreciendo de esta forma un excelente servicio, con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para hacerle mejoras al negocio dándole una mejor y agradable presentación, también surtirá adquiriendo cremas de belleza, acondicionadores, tinturas, tratamientos, etc. Sus ingresos se multiplicarán y podrá terminar su capacitación de belleza y cosmetología.
texts.en:
Ginna has a seven-year-old son, lives with her partner, and has experience in the field of cosmetology. For 12 years, she has had a hair salon in her home, running her business with the assistance of one employee. Ginna dreams of having her own location where she can continue building her skills every day and go on providing excellent service.

With this loan, she will buy construction materials to make improvements to her business, giving it a better and more welcoming feel. She will also stock her salon with beauty creams, conditioners, dyes, and treatments. This will multiply her revenues and she'll be able to complete her development as a cosmetologist.

loans.use: buy construction materials to make improvements to her business, giving it a better and more welcoming feel and to stock her salon with beauty creams, conditioners, dyes, and treatments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
34-year-old Angela is a single mother of one, living in the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She successfully operates a vegetable stall at the local business center selling tomatoes, onions, leafy vegetables and carrots. She started the business over six years ago in order to raise funds for her child’s school fees. 

Angela also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in Binga, visiting children in school and in the community. With the requested Kiva loan, she will make bulk purchases of vegetables and open her own vegetable shop. She will also use the proceeds to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes, cosmetics, perfumes, face powders and hairsprays

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and supplies for her workshop (zippers, elastic, buttons, etc.)

loans.name: Mujassarhon

texts.ru:
Хрупкая Муяссарахон - женщина пастух. Она отлично умеет разводить крупных рогатых скот и маленьких рогатых скот. На ровне с братом, Муяссарахон с детство помогала отцу в скотоводстве. После окончания школы не поступила в ВУЗ, а позже вышла замуж. У нее четверо детей. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода для ее собственной семьи. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. Вот уже много лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занятием скотоводство. В этом ей помогают муж и дети. 
В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами, Муяссарахон решила обратиться за кредитом и доверила МДО "Арванд" свой будущий доход и благополучие. На приобретенный кредит хочет купить корм и крупный рогатый скот. Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд" и  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
The fragile Mujassarhon is a female shepherd. She is very good at breeding cattle, sheep and goats. Just like her brother, Mujassarhon helped her father with livestock breeding since her childhood. After finishing school she did not start university, but got married. She has four children. 

Now her acquired skills and her father's occupation has become a source of income for her own family. She also works with dekhan farming, from which she gets vegetables, greens and fruit as daily food for the family. She has already brought "bread" to her family through livestock breeding for many years. Her husband and children help with this. 

Because of current difficulties with finances, Mujassarhon decided to take a loan and entrusted MDO "Arvand" with her future earnings and welfare. For the loan received she would like to purchase fodder and cattle. She thanks MDO "Arvand" in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela es soltera y tiene dos hijos por los cuales tiene que velar para un sustento, desde hace varios meses inició su negocio de venta de comidas, (perros, hamburguesas, salchichas, etc). Sueña con  tener un local más amplio,   organizado, agradable al público, esto llamará más la atención y aumentarán sus clientes. Ángela comprará un stock de diversos productos  (panes, salchichas, carnes, etc) de esta forma las ventas serán cada vez mayores representando ingresos mayores con lo cual tendrá un mejor estar para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Angela is single and has two children, for whom she has to provide sustenance. A number of months ago she began her business of selling food (hot dogs, hamburgers, sausages, etc.). She dreams of having a bigger location that is organized and pleasing to the public. This would call more attention and increase the number of customers. [With the loan] Angela will buy a stock of various products (breads, sausages, meats, etc.). In this way, her sales will increase, representing greater income, with which she will have a better situation for herself and her familiy.

loans.use: to buy a stock of various products (breads, sausages, meats, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, etc. in order to have her business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire tools (drills, shovels, carts, levels, etc) in order to have an own stock.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Agé de 64 ans, mariés à 4 femmes et père de 8 enfants, Moussa est propriétaire et gérant d’un dépôt de produits thérapeutiques depuis plusieurs ans, à Koutiala.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il décide de faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dont  Il est à son troisième prêt,  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des plantes pour la fabrication des produits thérapeutiques. Il effectue sa vente en détail et au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.
Mr envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa is 64 years of age, married to four wives and the father of eight children. He has been the owner and manager of a store selling [traditional herbal] medicinal products in Koutiala for a number of years.  

With the goal of meeting growing customer demand, he decided to turn to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He is now on his third loan, which will be used to buy plants for the preparation of medicinal products. He sells retail and for cash, to a mixed clientele.
Moussa plans to earn a monthly revenue of 150,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay his loan, provide for household needs, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plates, cups, bowls, pans, and buckets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shower slippers to sell

loans.name: Courtney

texts.en:
Courtney initially started her sole proprietorship, Blue No.7, in 2005 when she had been suffering from severe migraines and wanted to import and distribute health/wellness products into the marketplace, namely the old-fashioned Hot/Cold Ice Bag. This product had been a tried and true remedy for minor ailments and it had helped so much in providing relief in a natural way. So she set out to design modern patterns and import the product into the U.S. to distribute to retail stores.

What she loves the most is that she can get to be creative.  She created an idea that the consumer would find useful in their life. She also enjoys working with retail buyers and creating products that they want to see on their shelves.

She has over 20 years experience in the wholesale/ retail and import/export industries. She has also worked with national retailers such as Target, Whole Foods Market, The Container Store, and many more. The biggest challenges have been finding capital when the business is growing and keeping up with that growth. 

Courtney is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase inventory. She is also looking to sell her product to more retail stores. Her goal within the next 12 months is to offer additional Ice Bag patterns to capture a wider variety of retail clients. She is also working to enter Collegiate private label manufacturing, for example, UCLA Bruins themed Ice Bags.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Gulzira

texts.ru: Гульзире 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гульзиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульзира занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 бычок, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Гульзира планирует дополнительно заняться торговлей и намерена купить павильон и заняться торговлей на дому, так как ближайшие магазины находятся в центре села, поэтому Гульзира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку павильона. Доходы от кредита Гульзира планирует вложить в развитие торговли и намерена развить данный дополнительный бизнес.
texts.en: Gulzira is 46, married and raising 4 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and raises livestock for a living, first starting 10 years ago with 10,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Gulzira currently has a bull calf and 15 sheep on her farm, and her monthly income is nearly 10,000 som.  Additionally, she plans on setting up a pavilion at her house to sell various goods as the nearest stores are in the village center, and is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy said pavilion.  She plans on reinvesting any extra income due to the loan back into this new business of hers as she's keen on developing it.

loans.use: buy a pavilion to sell various goods from

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El  señor Aldo está casado, y comenta que se dedica a la compra y ventas de toritos olandos, tiene una camioneta en el cual se desplaza para realizar su trabajo.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora, que con ansias está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Este préstamo es para comprar toritos, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en: Aldo is married and he says he works buying and selling "holando" type small bulls. He has a station wagon, which he drives to do his job. He is a hardworking person, who with great desire is working hard to improve the conditions of his life and those of his family. He will use this loan to buy small bulls and in this way be able to continue with his job. He is grateful for this opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: To buy small bulls for sale or slaughter.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Mr Yacouba est âgé de 34 ans, marié d’une épouse et père de 2 enfants. Il vit à Koutiala. 
Depuis plus de 7ans Mr Yacouba exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente d’Huile pour moteur dans la ville de Koutiala. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa  notoriété est bonne. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Yacouba fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la premier fois. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de Bidons d’Huile moteur. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire le  besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba is 34 years old, married, and a father of two. He lives in Koutiala.

For over seven years, Mr. Yacouba has been in business buying and selling motor oil in the city of Koutiala. This business provides him with sufficient revenues, and his reputation is good. To satisfy his clientele and grow his business, Yacouba is turning to micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. This loan will be used to purchase cans of motor oil. He gets his supplies from Bamako, and retails in his shop in Koutiala. He sells cash, to a mixed-gender clientele.

With the development of his business, Mr. Yacouba expects a monthly profit of 60,000 XOF, which he will use to repay Soro’s interests and meet his family needs; the remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy motor oil.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto has been operating a physical therapy business for the past three years with the purpose of aiding and rehabilitating those affected by debilitating injuries. An avid sports fan, Fausto also tends to multiple athletes including a world champion boxer. 

Due to the nature of his business, insurance companies do not have to pay for his services until a maximum of three months post treatment. Thus, this places Fausto in a tough spot financially. With a loan from Accion, Fausto will be able to acquire a working capital flow and purchase state of the art laser equipment to help treat sinew lesions. 

Help Fausto regain financial independence and continue to pursue his dreams!

loans.use: to purchase laser equipment and use as working capital

loans.name: Arkidiy

texts.en:
Arkidiy, commonly known as Albert, has been working in the hair care industry since he was 15 years old. Thus, the natural progression became real when he opened Cuts and Color Bar. True to the name, Albert provides high quality haircuts with excellent amenities while customers wait. Using a full bar, free wifi, and his gregarious personality, Albert has found a recipe for success. 

Albert strives to keep a boutique sense for his clients, and dedicates his store to the idea that customers are family. His unrivaled customer service and equally unorthodox attention to consumers’ needs has readily increased his customer base. 

Albert wants to continue to expand and increase his client base. A loan will help him to increase his marketing outreach, including social media and Google advertising.

loans.use: to pay for marketing

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel drew inspiration for his business during one of the darkest times of his life. His son was tragically ill, to the point where Daniel felt compelled to work from home. Thankfully, his son lived and when it came time to pay for the hospital services, Daniel saw an opportunity. Due to the recent health care laws, all hospitals must have online records. Thus, Daniel started Worry Free Billing and now operates in multiple hospital and care networks with the purpose of providing patient record set up, set up electronic and manual medical claims filing, bill filing, claims posting, collection services, and many more. 

Daniel hopes to expand now more than ever, but he needs to update his software. With a loan, he will be able to purchase the necessary software and buy a new computer. Help Daniel expand his business and provide for his son!

loans.use: to purchase software and a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for marketing

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando and his wife Mercedes are the owners and operators of The Snack Place, Inc. This business has been in operation for just under five years and is most widely known for their ice cream sandwiches. Sold to local venders and bigger grocery corporations (i.e. Publix), the ice cream sandwiches account for most of Rolando’s revenue and have been a huge sensation in the Hispanic community of Orlando. 

Rolando hopes to continue to expand his enterprise. However, the next piece of equipment needed has a huge, upfront cost. Thus, Rolando needs to take out a loan in order to cover the cost. Help Rolando and his wife purchase the pricy equipment and continue to expand his business!

loans.use: to purchase food production equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grilling equipment and stock for the business (bread, meat, salsas, etc.).

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft drink dealer business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Annabelle earns more income from her general store.

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drink to sell for her soft drink dealer business. Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drink to sell.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school. Brigida is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has been raising cattle for 12 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Brigida has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle. In the future, Brigida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Liostina

texts.en:
Liostina is a married woman with four children. She is 35 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Liostina has a business raising cattle in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional cattle, vaccines and vitamins for her business. In the future, Liostina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle, vaccines and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Mirah Rose

texts.en:
Mirah Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines. Mirah Rose has been in this business for six years now.

Mirah Rose has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more beauty products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is currently in school. Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nenita has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis tiene 49 años de edad,  esta casado,  él no estudio ningún grado académico debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos  y no pudieron darle una educación. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero de igual forma le ayuda a él en el trabajo de la agricultura, es padre de dos hijas una de 26 años y otras de 24 años que ya no viven con él.  

Luis se inicio en la agricultura a la edad de 12 años, su padre desde esa edad lo llevaba a trabajar en la siembra de maíz. Al formar su propio hogar Luis se dedico mas de lleno a la agricultura y ganadería el trabajo lo realiza junto con su esposa e hijas que cuando tiene tiempo libre se dedican a ayudarle a Luis en el trabajo de campo.

Luis utilizara el crédito para comprar tres novillos de repasto, ya que su idea es engordarlos en un año luego los venderá y con la ganancia obtenida cancelara lo que es su crédito y comprara algunos alimentos para el sostenimiento de su hogar 

Luis sueña que su esposa y sus hijas y nietos tengan un buen futuro y que no pasen por lo que él paso y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and married.  He did not go to school because his parents had scarce financial resources, and they were not able to give him an education.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  However, she does help him with the agricultural work.  He has two daughters, ages 26 and 24.  They do not live with him.

Luis started working in agriculture when he was 12 years old.  At that age his father took him to work growing corn.  Upon forming his own household, Luis devotes himself fully to agriculture and livestock.  He does this work with his wife and daughters.  When they have free time they help Luis with the field work.

Luis will use the loan to buy three head of cattle.  His idea is to fatten them in a year and then sell them.  With the earnings he gets from this, he will repay his loan and buy some food as sustenance for his household.

Luis dreams of his wife, his daughters, and his grandchildren having a good future.  He dreams that they will not experience what he did, and that they become good people.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle.

loans.name: Anven

texts.en:
Anven is a 60-year-old-married woman and has six children, three who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anven has a buy and sell mangoes business in the Philippines. Anven requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional mangoes to sell.

Anven has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Anven would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional mangoes to sell

loans.name: Alberto Enrique

texts.es: Alberto vive con su pareja y tienen 3 hijos, reside en una ciudad al norte del país, junto con su familia, en la actualidad ya cumplió 10 años de estar trabajando con la cría de pollos y de cerdos, pero ha tenido dificultades económicas y sueña con ampliar y mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales, también con tener una planta de engorde de pollos, por esto pasa la solicitud de préstamo, el cual invertirá en comprar más cerdos y también más pollos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos, su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.
texts.en:
Alberto lives with his life partner, and they have three children.  He lives with his family in a city in the northern part of the country.  He has been working and raising chickens and pigs for ten years.  However, he has had financial difficulties.  

He dreams of expanding and improving the place where he raises his animals.  He also dreams of having a chicken fattening plant.  This is why he is requesting the loan.  He will buy more pigs and chickens to fatten.  His business is well-accepted because of the good way he raises and maintains the animals.

His quality of life and that of his family will improve as his animal sales increase.  He will reach his established goals for the near future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea works hard to support her family. Aurea is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aurea requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Aurea has been in this business for 20 years now.

Aurea would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and the pig-raising supplies necessary to fatten and care for these animals.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 25 años, vive con sus padres, trabaja como niñera de un niño autista en una casa de familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y ella dice que va afianzándose en la profesión que escogió estudiar con la tarea diaria de cuidar con cariño y especial atención a este niño aunque gane muy poco dinero por hacerlo. Su padre es corredor de quiniela y su madre tiene un pequeño kiosco en su casa; desde siempre aprendió la responsabilidad y el esfuerzo por superarse de ellos. Liliana es la primera en estudiar de su familia y piensa ser el ejemplo para sus hermanos. 
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de la universidad para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Liliana is 25 years old. She lives with her parents and works as a nanny for an autistic child in a family home.

She is studying psychology, and she says that she is getting a foothold in the profession that she chose to study with the daily work of caring lovingly and with special attention for this child, although she earns very little money for doing it. Her father is a betting broker, and her mother has a little kiosk in their home. From them, she has always learned responsibility and the effort to better herself. Liliana is the first one in her family to study [at the university level], and she thinks of being an example for her siblings.

She is applying for this loan to pay her university bills so that she can continue going to school.

loans.use: to pay university bills

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José es una persona que desde hace muchos años se dedica al comercio, como vendedor ha adquirido mucha experiencia, en la actualidad esta actividad la lleva a cabo vendiendo zapatos, tennis, visitando diferentes pueblos de la zona metropolitana y también en zonas rurales donde se presenta la mayor demanda de la mercancía y el número de clientes ha aumentado favorablemente, José requiere el préstamos para surtirse en variedad de calzado y aprovechar la temporada que se avecina, todo esto le representa ganancias y aumento en sus ingresos, lo que le facilita poder seguir brindando a sus hijos el estudio necesario y adecuado que ellos requieren y que se proyecten un buen futuro.
texts.en: José has spent several years in business. As a merchant he has acquired a lot of experience. At the moment he is selling tennis shoes. He visits different towns in the urban area and also in rural areas, where his merchandise is in greatest demand and the number of clients has increased considerably. José needs the loan in order to restock his business with a variety of shoes and take advantage of the approaching season. All of this means profits and an increase in his earnings, which will make it easier for him to be able to continue giving his children the education they need so they can have a good future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes

loans.name: Azmabeth

texts.en:
Azmabeth is 33 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Azmabeth has a buy and sell personal collection products business in the Philippines. Azmabeth requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from personal collection to sell.

Azmabeth has been in this business for 5 years. Azmabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from personal collection to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and single.  

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional merchandise like candies, biscuits, cooking oil, salt, sugar, coffee, etc., to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like candies, biscuits, cooking oil, salt, sugar, coffee, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is the sole owner of Punkk Society Clothing, an urban clothing brand that produces casual, authentic clothing items including shirts, hats, belts, etc. Dedicated to creating authentic clothing that is “edgy, innovative, and 100% original,” Natasha has built a small following throughout the Northeast and has even been able to market her items through a small boutique in New York. 

She hopes to continue to expand her line and hopes to cut costs where possible. Currently, most of her printing and design have been done by outside contractors. However, Natasha has taken multiple classes in screen printing and Photoshop in order to implement her designs in house and effectively cut costs in half. 
	
With a loan, Natasha will be able to purchase the software needed to screen print in house. Help Natasha expand her booming business of edgy apparel!

loans.use: to purchase software to do screen printing

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Diciembre se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son de una zona muy alejada del centro, que aún está en crecimiento, eminentemente rural.
Maria es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos y demás, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo hace para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que por medio de eso podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The “8 de Diciembre” Group was formed by several neighbours in the city of Santaní. They are from an area which is very far away from the centre of the city and is still a growing rural area.

Maria is one of the members of the group. She makes a living by raising and selling or slaughtering farmyard animals, such as hens and pigs. She does with a lot of sacrifice and effort in order to help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of feed for her animals, since in this way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing and continue striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 40-year-old married woman and has three children, one of which is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cresilda has a general store business in the Philippines. Cresilda requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more merchandise like cereals, chocolate drinks, detergent, bath soap, soft-drinks, etc., to sell.

Cresilda has been in this business for 22 years. Cresilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like cereals, chocolate drinks, detergent, bath soap, soft-drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lilian works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Lilian is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Lofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling used clothing. Lofelia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Working for the family business with his father, Rodney quickly learned the tips and tricks of the trade of infrared thermography services. Rodney noticed a complete lack of infrared thermographic services in the residential sector and decided to capitalize by opening Kansas Thermal Imaging. A relatively new technology, thermal imagery can be used in home energy audits, building envelopes, and both electrical and flat roof inspections.

Despite a readily available market, the general public has little experience with this new technology and requires educational advertisement in order to implement it. With a loan, Rodney will be able to increase outreach and educate the public on his services. 

Help Rodney create a new, booming industry in the housing sector of Kansas!

loans.use: to pay for advertising

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah has owned his own business for over seven years and specializes in media advertisement through video production, television, radio, and internet ads. He focuses most explicitly on “Professional Media made simple.”

He currently has a wide customer base spanning from Oklahoma to most of the South-Central United States and is actively looking to continue to expand. However, due to tough financial times during the recession, Jeremiah has found it difficult to acquire the necessary loans to expand his enterprise. 

With a loan, Jeremiah will be able to purchase business equipment such as additional cameras and increase local advertising. Help Jeremiah expand his business!

loans.use: to purchase additional cameras and increase advertising outreach

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old, married, and has five children. With one child still in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Nilda has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, detergent, bath soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie works hard to support her family. Normie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Normie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Normie has been in this business for 3 years now.

Normie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a buy and sell native mats business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more native mats to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell

loans.name: Virgencita

texts.en:
Virgencita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virgencita is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Virgencita has a buy and sell of mangoes business in the Philippines. Virgencita requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell in her fruit stand.

Virgencita has been in this business for 20 years. Virgencita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Keel

texts.en:
Keel represents an interesting mix of resilience, courage, and business innovation. He started and currently operates ICYTALENT GROUP, INC with which he conducts two separate DBAs known as Umbree and Umbree rain gear. Despite taking a leave of absence in 2008 to serve our country in Iraq, he has successfully run his enterprise and is currently fielding offers for contractual agreements with Disney and the Hard Rock Café. 

Keel has met with success and hopes to continue to expand his enterprise; however, he needs money to purchase inventory for larger orders such as the aforementioned Disney Contract. 

Help Keel grow his business and serve an ever growing customer base!

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is a married woman.  She has seven children, four of whom attend school and three who are underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kavumbi operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is appreciative for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

Besides the fish selling business, Mwanahamisi operates a green grocery business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.
