loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. .She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last year, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil,and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and has six children, five of whom attend school and one is underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, biscuits, bread, maize flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, biscuits, bread, maize flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for resale.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
 
Mbodze has operated a milk selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase gallons of milk for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is ready for her second Kiva loan and things couldn’t be going better for Tap Fever Dance Studio!  

Since launching Tap Fever, Larisa has been sharing her passion and love of dance, offering a variety of dance classes including tap, jazz, ballet, contemporary, hip-hop, and partner dancing to people of all ages. Her mission-based organization specializes in teaching dance to those with disabilities, along with offering dance scholarships for low-income individuals and mentoring for at-risk teens. 

Larisa has recently added some key members to her board of directors, including individuals who are supporting her with marketing efforts, fundraising and grant writing. Because of these new additions Tap Fever Dance Studio has applied for their first grant and are confident they are going to get it. 

This second Kiva loan of $6,000 will enable Larisa to fund her traveling dance team to compete in competitions throughout the country and to support her marketing efforts promoting Tap Fever Studios and their upcoming events. Tap Fever’s mission continues to be building self-esteem, athleticism and giving back to the community and with this loan, Larisa can help promote and perform that mission.

For more information on Tap Fever Studios and its mission, go to www.TapFever.com.

loans.use: to fund her traveling dance team to compete in competitions and to support her marketing efforts

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 55 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Susie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Susie requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Susie has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell mango business in the Philippines.

Vevencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell.

Vevencia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Vevencia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elma has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

Elma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Divina Josie

texts.en:
Divina Josie works hard to support her family. Divina Josie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Divina Josie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Divina Josie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Emerlyn is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eva Mae

texts.en:
Eva Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for One year now, and also earns additional income from laundry services.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.  Eva Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

loans.name: Big Mista's Barbecue Group

texts.en:
Bigmista’s Barbecue is owned and operated by husband-and-wife team, Neil, “Bigmista”, and Phyllis, “Mrs. Mista”. It started out as a way for Neil to raise money for barbecue competitions he started doing back in 2006. He would cook lunches that Phyllis would then deliver to places such as Kaiser, Wells Fargo and LACOE.

The idea to compete came from the great guys Neil met on the BBQ Brethren Forum. After posting, reading and finding community on the site, he decided he wanted a BBQ smoker. At the time, they lived in a two-bedroom apartment. As competitions produced awards, so came more requests for Neil’s signature barbecue.

After a brief period of unemployment, Phyllis decided it was time to dedicate her time into expanding their talents into a business.
 
They started vending at the Watts Certified Farmers’ Market (CFM) on Saturdays in November 2008. With plans to grow slowly, they hit the road crawling. It never occurred to either of them that folks were getting ready for Thanksgiving and other holiday parties (who wants barbecue during the holiday season?). Sales were truly pitiful. 

By February 2009, Phyllis had registered them into six farmers’ markets that Neil couldn't do because he was still with Wells Fargo. She explained to him that it didn't make sense for them to pay people to do what Neil wanted to do. He tried to talk his boss into letting him work part-time (afraid to take the leap). He came home disappointed that his boss said no. He was soon all smiles when Phyllis told him to go ahead and quit. It scared both of them, but they were stepping out on faith and good food. 

Ever since then, Neil and Phyllis have put all their time and efforts into making their business grow successfully. The Kiva loan will allow them to open a full-service restaurant that would help to increase activity in all service areas of the business. It would also allow the company to increase its capacity to increase farmers' market presence.

loans.use: to expand their catering services and eventually open their storefront restaurant.

Victoria es una persona luchadora, tiene un hijo y comenta que desea salir adelante para poder dar a su hijo todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Quiere salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades, quiere tener el título universitario para poder trabajar en su profesión de contadora. Ella quiere tener su propio estudio contable, y es por eso que lucha para cumplir su meta.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad, ya que está necesitando para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a fighter. She has one son and comments that she wishes to come out ahead in order to be able to give him everything that she could not have. She wants to come out ahead despite difficulties, and she wants to have a university degree in order to be able to work in a career as an accountant. She wants to have her own accountant's office, and it is for that that she is fighting to accomplish her goal. 

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to cover her university fees as she needs it to be able to continue studying. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ginaline

texts.en:
Ginaline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ginaline is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ginaline has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Ginaline requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her weaving business.

Ginaline has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ginaline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

Merlinda has been in this business for 29 years. Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Merlinda

loans.name: Mengnihol

texts.ru: Менгнихол бизнес-леди из района Вахш. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем, родила и вырастила пятерых сыновей. Менгнихол очень ответственный и деятельный человек. Шесть лет назад она открыла свой малый бизнес в сфере продаж продуктов питания и по сей день продолжает его с помощью семьи. В данный момент Менгнихол нуждается в кредите. Ее младший сын учится в первом курсе Государственного Университета города Кургантюбе и ей необходимо сейчас оплатить за годовое обучение сына. Менгнихол с надеждой ждет поддержки и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своего бизнеса. Данный кредит поможет ее сыну продолжить учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Mengnihol is a businesswoman from the Vakhsh region. She is 56 years old, married, and has given birth to and raised five sons. Mengnihol is a very responsible and energetic person.  She began her own small grocery business six years ago, and she continues it today with her family's help. Right now,  Mengnihol needs a loan. Her youngest son is a first-year student at the state university in Qurghonteppa, and she needs to pay now for the year's tuition. Mengnihol waits with hope for support and promises to pay the loan back through her business. The loan will help her son continue studying at the university.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university education, so that he can continue his studies.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved Oware game boards. He would like to purchase wood, marbles, and finishing materials. Kofi has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: Nicknamed 'Tall' for his impressive height, Kofi is a master craftsman of the world famous Oware (Mancala) game. "After trying my hand at different jobs, one day I walked into a friend's art studio at the National Cultural Center and asked him to show me anything I can do around there, and I would do it. I did not realize that it was the beginning of a career. Then we received an order for carved oware games and within four weeks I had developed and mastered my own style. Now I also enjoy researching the game, and its history." "Thank you for this microcredit - it is very considerate of you to take an interest in the growth of my business." Use the link below to view Kofi's hand-carved oware game boards on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1416

loans.use: to purchase wood, marbles, and finishing materials for his game sets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and a sewing machine.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Rogelia has been in this business for 6 years. Rogelia earns additional income from a general store.

Rogelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirian es una joven luchadora y emprendedora, tiene una bebé de 20 meses, por la que anhela salir adelante, ella tiene experiencia en la cría y engorde de cerdos, trabaja en zona rural en otro departamento, sueña con adquirir mayor número de animales para la venta, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en comprar cerdos y los insumos para el cuidado y engorde, las ganancias que generan las ventas le ayudarán a Miriam a solucionar la situación económica y mejorará el nivel de vida de forma trascendental.
texts.en: Mirian is a hardworking young woman and entrepreneur. She has a 20-month-old baby and she longs to get ahead. She has experience in breeding and fattening pigs. She works in a rural area in another department. She dreams of acquiring more animals for sale. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying pigs and supplies to care for and fatten them. The profits she generates by her sales will help Mirian solve her economic situation and improve their standard of living to help them overcome.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and the supplies to care for and fatten them.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni is a Balinese artisan who specializes in silk batik items. She would like to purchase silk, canting tools, and batik stamps.

Yuni has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Yuni learned the art of batik when she was very young from her mother. She has been making batik at home in Java for over 23 years, "while waiting each day for my father to come home from the sea. We still design together, especially the floral and bird motifs that are typical in Pekalongan batik. My husband Rieckey also helps me a lot, but as a woman, I'm very proud of the fact that I can have the career that I love, and to be able to provide for myself and my family."

"I want to give a million thanks for your support and for trusting me with this incentive. This support will help keep my venture growing by allowing me to offer work to batik artisans. I have received many requests for my products, but because my capital is not much, I cannot fulfill all of them. I need capital that would allow me to stock up on silk and batik materials to fulfill these orders. I am really counting on this interest-free microcredit to speed up our batik production. Our sales are increasing, but there are not enough of us to meet orders. We are making a great big effort to work at full capacity, but it is not enough if we do not get more people to help us or cannot buy more silk and new canting for new batik designs. To all of you who have offered your support, I would like to express my biggest thanks."

Use the link below to view Yuni's silk batik items on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5981

loans.use: to purchase silk, canting tools, and batik stamps

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.en:
Xayyam is a married man and has a child. He and his wife have been married for ten years. His child is six years old, and this year he will start to school. The family is living in the Fuzuli region. For 20 years now, Xayyam’s family has been an Internally Displaced Peoples from their native land. To earn a living, Xayyam is a taxi driver. Specifically, he transports passengers between Baku and Fuzuli.

Now he is seeking to expand his business. As a result, he is applying for a loan in amount of 500 AZN- Azerbaijan New Manat to pay for repairs on his car. In the future, he would like to paint his car. Xayyam is thankful to Kiva organization for their support.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on his car

loans.name: Elcan

Now Elcan lives in Seyidehmedli village of Fuzuli region. His wife is a house-wife and Elcan is a market seller. He sells mixed goods at his rental store. Elcan has spent over 9 years working in the local market. Today he plans to increase his business. For this reason he needs 1,400 AZN to buy new goods for selling. In this way he will sell more products and earn more money. In the future Elcan wants to have a car and improve his shop. He thanks Kiva organization for the loan and for helping him increase his business.

loans.use: to buy new goods for selling

Liz está esforzando por cumplir su objetivo, es por eso que está estudiando muy duro.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, con lo cual podrá estudiar y cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:

She is studying for a career and license in nursing.  She is a person who is dedicated to this career and through this she can help her family.

Liz is striving to fulfill this purpose which is why she is studying very hard.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in paying her fees so that she can study and cover the expenses that she has.

Alexandra dreams of having a larger business and purchasing materials and ingredients for this activity. 

With the loan she has requested she will buy a large thermos, supplies (cups, napkins, spoons, jars, etc.) and fill her business with fresh and good quality products, so that people who visit her business can leave happy and well cared for.

loans.use: to buy a large cooler, supplies (cups, napkins, spoons, jars, etc.) and fill her business with fresh and good quality products.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Helen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
