loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is 37 years old and her husband is 50 years old. Dipali is a housewife and her husband is an electrician in Dhupguri. Dipali received an education up to grade 9 and her husband has completed class X (grade 10). Dipali has three children and all of them are receiving a higher education. 

Prior to her husband's business, he was engaged in an electric shop where he learned how to repair electronic goods. Taking those experiences, he has opened his own shop where he sells different types of electrical goods such as switch boxes, electric wares, switches, bulbs and tube lights etc. and he repairs electronic goods. But, due to the competitive market, there are many of these shops nearby, so it becomes very difficult for him to sell the electric goods. For this reason, Dipali needs money to purchase many modern electric goods to attract the customer. Hence, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can purchase different modern electric goods to enhance their business. She hopes that, with the profit from her business, she will build a concrete house for her family.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with 6 children. With 3 children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta está, casada y tiene dos hijos, ella es docente y comenta que su aspiración es seguir estudiando para obtener mejores logros, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Master en Educación.
Ella está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, ya que quiere poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Mirta is married and has two children. She is a teacher and tells us that her dream is to continue studying so that she can achieve more. Because of this, she is working on her Masters in Education. She is fighting to improve living conditions for her and her family, since she wants to be able to give them everything that she couldn't have. She asks for this loan to cover her university costs so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale (accessories, perfumes, hair clips)

loans.name: Esterling

texts.en:
Esterling works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Esterling requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional units and tools for her business.

Esterling would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional units and tools for her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 54 years old and has 5 children. Eufemia is married and has 4 children who are currently in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Eufemia has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Tilottama

texts.en:
Tilottama is a 22-year-old married woman. She stays with her husband and her two children in a small town in Dhupguri. Both Tilottama and her husband are illiterate and only know how to sign their name. Due to a lack of money, only one of the children receives an education. 

Tilottama is a housewife and her husband is a cycle van puller, The cycle van is rented from a local owner. From the beginning, they have faced many problems while running the family. Then Tilottama learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan to purchase a cycle van. Now her husband pulls his own cycle van. Like a rickshaw and auto, a cycle van is also one kind of puller that carries people from one place to another, especially in remote areas. Now their family is earning money. She hopes their financial condition will improve and she can build a concrete house with her business profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for business purposes.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is a married woman with 7 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Epefania is 64 years old and has 1 child who is still in school.

Epefania has a firewood-vending business in the Philippines. Epefania requested a loan of 27,000 PHP amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Epefania has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Epefania would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mukta

texts.en:
Mukta is a 29-year-old married woman and her husband is 50 years old. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. They have one son who is too small to go to school. Mukta lives in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri District. Mukta and her husband have completed grade 10 and graduation, respectively.

Her husband’s income is too low to run a family and to care for her son. Like every mother, Mukta also dreams of giving her best to her child. So she plans to do something on her own. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for radish cultivation. She hopes to have a good harvest and earn more profit from this. She is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for radish cultivation.

loans.name: Marani

texts.en:
Marani is 47 years old and married. Her husband is 54 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their name. They live in Haspatal para, which is in the Dhupguri region. Marani has two children. One of them is completing her bachelor's degree and the other one is appearing for the grade 10 examination. 

From the very beginning, Marani has faced many difficulties while running the family. Her husband runs a fish business, but sales are low due to a lack of variety of items.  From her friend, Marani came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and that BJS gives loans. So she applied for a loan to purchase many different kinds of fish to sell in her local market. This will help her to meet the local people’s demands. She dreams that with her business profit, she can enhance her business and be a good entrepreneur.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fish to increase the business.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of three children in Dhupguri. Her children all go to school to receive an education. Jyotsna and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign her name. They struggle hard to bear all the household expenses of their family, but still they cannot cover all the household and educational expenses of their children. 

Jyotsna is a housewife and her husband is a farmer.  Both Jyotsna and her husband dream of giving a good future to their children. To provide a good future, money is required and for that reason, they decided to enhance their business. Hence, they planned to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can purchase mustard seeds and fertilizers to grow mustard in their field. They hope to earn more money by selling mustard in the local market. She is a very courageous lady who wants to prosper in life.  She gives thanks to Kiva and BJS equally for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing mustard.

loans.name: Sitarani

texts.en:
Sitarani is a 42-year-old married woman from Dhupguri. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive an education. Now Sitarani is a mother of two children and they are studying in school. 

She has taken a loan for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is running a wood business, selling firewood in the local market. Both Sitarani and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children. They dream that their future is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. Now, Sitarani lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with this loan, she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks & cement). Sitarani and her husband are successfully running their business and have held the market for selling milk products.

Sitarani thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenefer is 42 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Jenefer has a native bags and mats manufacturing business in the Philippines. Jenefer requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Jenefer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jenefer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Juana Anita

texts.en:
Juana Anita is 70 years old and married with seven children. Juana Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Juana Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like juice, milk, coffee, detergent, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Juana Anita has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as juice, milk, coffee, detergent, soap, toothpaste, etc. 

Juana Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like juice, milk, coffee, detergent, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Jhuma is a 23-year-old rural housewife who lives with her husband Ganesh and two children (one son and one daughter) in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of mud, wood and bamboo). Jhuma and her husband both have primary educations. One of their children is receiving an education and is in grade three and the other is below the school-going age.

Jhuma's husband Ganesh is engaged in the business of bamboo-made baskets.  He purchases bamboo from his locality and makes baskets with the help of his wife Jhuma.  Together they carry the baskets to the local markets and sell them. This product is in great demand because the local people belong to a poor section and are mostly cultivators.  They cannot expand their business because they need to purchase more bamboo, but are unable to do so due to a lack of money.

So, Jhuma has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more bamboo. They want to make more baskets to satisfy their customers' demand.  This is the only source of income for the family, so they are trying their hardest to improve their business. This will help them to earn more profit to run the family well and meet all the basic needs of their children.

Jhuma wants to go ahead with this business in order to give a financial stability to the family.  She is, therefore, very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for granting her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a native bags manufacturing business in the Philippines. Lucia has been in this business for 10 years now. 

Lucia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her native bags business. Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her native bags business

loans.name: Chalema

texts.en:
Chalema is a 37-year-old married, hardworking lady. She lives with her husband and one grown-up son in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo). She and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Her husband Jaminul, 45 years old, is a farmer. Their son is unemployed.

Chalema's husband is associated with an agribusiness. He grows different crops on his small plot of land.  He works hard to grow good quality products to sell in the local markets with the help of Chalema. As his income is modest and hardly enough to cover expenses, he can't generate a profit as expected and needed for the family. They thought of purchasing a cycle van (a vehicle for carrying goods and people in the rural areas) for additional income. He will carry harvest products to the market and carry people for extra income. 

Chalema has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.  Her husband is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to provide his family members with a normal standard of living.

Chalema hopes this new business will give their family financial stability to fulfill her dream of purchasing more cycle-vans in the future for further income.

She is thankful to her lenders, Kiva and BJS, for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Lilia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. 

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 53 years old and married with three children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Leonila aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 32 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ludy is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludy has been in the pig-fattening business for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and married with nine children.

Maria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maria has been in the pig fattening business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Maride

texts.en:
Maride is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maride is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maride has a firewood and charcoal sales business in the Philippines. Maride requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal for her business.

Maride has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Maride would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 48 years old and has five children. Marites is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marites requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru:
Иномчон трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 45 лет. Он женат и является многодетным отцом, так как имеет четверых детей. Иномчон со своей женой живут душа в душу и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Иномчон  трудолюбивый человек, и он вот уже как 17 лет занимается своим бизнесом. У него имеется шашлычная лавка, где он изготавливает и продаёт шашлык. От этого бизнеса Иномчон получает хороший доход.

В этом деле Иномчону также помогает старший сын, который старается изучить все тонкости данной работы. Год за год дети Иномчона растут,  а также растут потребности всей семьи. Поэтому сейчас Иномчон планирует расширять свой бизнес, чтобы иметь достаточно дохода на проживание. Иномчон  сотрудничает с Арванд уже более двух лет. И сейчас он в очередной раз обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить больше инвентаря для обустройства шашлычного прилавка, чтобы и дальше расширять свой бизнес. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Inomjon is a hardworking 45-year-old man.  He is married and is the father of many children as he has 4 of them.  Inomjon and his wife live happily together and try to raise their children to be good people.  Inomjon has been running his own kebab stall for 17 years, where he cooks and sells kebabs and earns a good living doing so.

Inomjon's oldest son also helps with the family business, and tries his best to learn all its nuances.  Year by year, Inomjon's children grow, and the needs of the family grow as well.  As such, Inomjon is planning on expanding his business to be able to earn enough money for living expenses.  Inomjon has taken loans through Arvand for more than 2 years already, and is seeking a loan once again to stock up on all the necessary items and equipment to expand his kebab business.  He would like to thank Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: buy equipment for his kebab barbecue stall

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз начинающий предприниматель. Он только окончил Университет и сразу преступил к делу. Ему 25 лет. Фируз живет с родителями. Он хочет открыть место для фастфуда. Фируз нашел подходящее место и уже успел повесить рекламу и вывеску.  В его меню входить шаурма, хот доги и мороженное. Но бизнес полноценно еще не открылся. У него отсутствует оборудование для приготовления шаурмы и мороженного. У Фируз не хватает денег, чтобы купить оборудование и по этой причине обратился за поддержкой. Фируз верит и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Firuz is a budding entrepreneur.  He recently graduated from college and is seeking to hit the ground running with his new business.  He is 25, lives with his parents, and wants to open a new fast food stall.  He's found a good spot and has already put out a sign and an ad.  Among the items on the menu will be shawarma, hot dogs and ice cream.  For all his plans, Firuz lacks the money to buy all the equipment he needs, and is thus seeking a loan.  He is counting on your help.

loans.use: buy equipment to make shawarma and ice cream

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers for her business buying and selling charcoal.

Melissa has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Melissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Cherry has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall.

Cherry has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet café business in the Philippines.

Concordia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to pay internet and electric bills.

Concordia has been in this business for two years now.

Concordia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay internet and electric bills

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 41 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, toothpaste, bath soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary napkins, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as the above. 

Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, toothpaste, bath soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary napkins, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is 63 years old and married with three children.

Ella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Ella has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ella aspires to saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Elvira has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling peanut butter.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is 43 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Elsie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business, which she has been in for 6 years. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 61 years old and widowed with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Eulalia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business, which she has been in for 11 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 51 years old and married with seven children. 

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Genara would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, etc. for her handicraft business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is 37 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Hazel has a rope making business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business, which she has been running for 7 years. 

In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Ermila

texts.en:
Ermila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Ermila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional beauty products and tools for her business.

Ermila has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Ermila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products and tools for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Joyet

texts.en:
Joyet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Joyet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as pork, seasonings and chicken for her food production business.

Joyet has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pork, seasonings and chicken for her food production business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Leonila has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Liza has a rope making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Liza has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Malumi

texts.en:
Malumi is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Malumi has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Malumi has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for six years now.

Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a rope making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her rope making business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susan has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Susan has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Tites Theresa

texts.en:
Tites Theresa is single and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Tites Theresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Tites Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Meilin

texts.en:
Meilin is 40 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Meilin works very hard to provide for them.

Meilin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as soft drinks, shampoo, cooking oil, bread and sanitary napkins to sell.

Meilin has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, cooking oil, bread and sanitary napkins. 

Meilin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as soft drinks, shampoo, cooking oil, bread and sanitary napkins to sell

loans.name: Alfonso De Jesús

texts.es: Luis, de 46 años de edad, es viudo, desde hace 20 años trabajaba como guarda de seguridad, y esta actividad la alternaba con una tienda que tenía por parte de su madre el cual le cedió para cancelarlo por cuotas, la tienda por temporadas la administraba su hijo, pero Luis decidió dedicarse por completo al negocio familiar; renunció a la otra actividad. Sueña con terminar de cancelar esta deuda, con el restante  comprará surtido  (gaseosas, lácteos, galletería, dulces, etc) para el negocio, ya es muy reconocido en el barrio donde está ubicado. y será una de las mejores alternativas para seguir incrementando sus ingresos, mejorando el bienestar de la famiia.
texts.en:
Luis, 46, is a widower and has worked for 20 years as a security guard.  He used to alternate this acitivity with working at the store his mother sold to him on a credit basis.  The son used to manage the store occasionally, but Luis decided to take over the family business completely and gave up the other job.

His goal is to pay off his debt and buy goods (sodas, dairy products, cookies, sweets, etc.) for the business since it is very well-known in its neighborhood.  It will be one of the best ways to continue increasing his income and providing his family with a good lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy goods (sodas, dairy products, cookies, sweets, etc.)

loans.name: Viviana María

texts.es: Viviana de 47 años y madre de dos hijos, se ha desempeñado en el área de venta de alimentos preparados, ha tenido varios negocios tipo restaurante y ahora pretende invertir el crédito en la compra de un congelador, una estufa a gas, insumos y utensilios para el montaje del nuevo negocio en una zona comercial, donde cree que le iría mejor. Ella ya tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio y con el nuevo proyecto generará dos empleos directos, por lo que es un logro para ella, pues pretende mejorar su nivel de vida y los ingresos para el sustento propio y de su familia; y cumplir su sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Viviana, 47, has two children and she works selling food.  She has had several restaurants and now is requesting a loan to buy a freezer, gas stove, supplies and utensils to set up a new business in a commercial area where she believes business will be better.

She has vast experience in this activity and will generate two jobs with the new project, so it is an accomplishment for her.  She hopes to improve her lifestyle and income level to support herself and her family.  She wants to carry out her dream of buying her own home.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, gas stove, supplies and utensils.

loans.name: Omar De Jesús

texts.es: Omar es un hombre humilde, casado y padre de tres hijos, que hace más de doce años se dedica a la compra, cría y engorde de cerdos, en la finca donde trabaja, pues el dueño le ha dado el espacio y el permiso para hacer este trabajo, con el cual busca el sustento de su familia. Omar quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de los lechones y en el arreglo del corral. Su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y no tener que hacer dos trabajos, pues se ha sentido muy enfermo los últimos tiempos.
texts.en:
Omar is a humble man who is married and has three children.  Over 12 years ago he decided to buy and raise pigs on the farm where he works.  The owner of the farm has allotted him space and given him permission to do this work in order to earn an income for his family.

Omar wants to use the loan to buy two piglets and fix the pig pen.  His dream is to improve his living conditions and not have to work two jobs, since he has been very ill lately.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and fix the pig pen.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 45 years old and married now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of biscuits, canned goods, candies, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Alma has been in this business for 21 years. Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of biscuits, canned goods, candies, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Piedad Cecilia

texts.es: Piedad es una mujer humilde y madre de dos hijos, que se dedicaba a la preparación y venta de tamales, empanadas y otros alimentos; pero desde hace unos años realizó cursos de estilista y ahora se dedica a hacer corte y tintura de cabello, arreglo de uñas y otros procedimientos de belleza a domicilio. Ella quiere invertir su crédito en la compra de elementos de trabajo como esmaltes, toallas, tinturas y otros, para poder ampliar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Piedad is a humble woman and the mother of two children.  She used to work making and selling tamales, meat pies and other food but decided to take a hairdressing course several years ago, and now cuts and colors hair, does manicures and other beauty procedures by visiting her clients at their homes.

She wants to use the loan to buy products for her work such as nail polish, towels, hair color and other items in an aim to expand her customer base and improve her income so she can give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy products for her work, such as nail polish, towels, hair color and other items.

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es: Jaime es un adulto mayor, soltero y padre de dos hijos mayores de edad, quien hace más de veinte años se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, víveres, refrescos, dulces y otros elementos. Trabaja en compañía de su hermana y alterna su trabajo con la actividad de construcción. Jaime quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de abarrotes, lácteos y demás productos para su negocio, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poder ampliar el surtido y el local que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Jaime is single and the father of two adult children.  For over 20 years he has been running a grocery store, where he sells goods, beverages, sweets and other items.  He works with his sister and alternates this work with a construction job.

Jaime wants to use the loan to buy groceries, dairy products and other items for his business.  His aim is to improve his income and expand the store.

loans.use: To buy groceries, dairy products and other products for his store.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny es una joven emprendedora dedicada actualmente a la actividad de la panadería y repostería en compañía de su esposo, quien conoce desde hace varios años la actividad. Los productos los venden en tiendas con las cuales tienen acuerdos hace un tiempo y también entre sus vecinos y familiares.
Fanny pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de una máquina cilindradora y la materia prima en cantidades más grandes y así obtener un descuento, con el fin de obtener mayor ganancia y sacar mayor producción. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y tener un local más grande por fuera de las instalaciones de su casa y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fanny is a young businesswoman who is currently working in bakery and pastry making along with her husband, who has known the business for several years. They sell their products in shops which they have had an agreement with for some time, as well as selling to neighbours and family members.

Fanny plans to use her loan to buy a rolling machine and raw materials in larger quantities so she can get a discount. The purpose of this is to increase her production and make a bigger profit.

Her dream is to increase the size of her business and have bigger premises outside of her home, and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a rolling machine and larger quantities of raw ingredients at a discount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nora Patricia

texts.es: Nora es una mujer emprendedora, quien hace nueve años se dedica a la actividad de marroquinería. Elabora y vende bolsos, billeteras y demás artículos hechos en cuero, que han gustado mucho en el mercado, por su exclusividad en los diseños y su elaborada decoración, arte para el que toma clases en una institución. Ella quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de cuero y herrajes, para tener una producción más grande y variada de sus artículos y sueña con ampliar el mercado y tener nuevos canales de distribución, con lo que mejoraría considerablemente sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nora is an enterprising woman who has been making a living from leather work for nine years. She makes and sells bags, wallets and other leather items, which have been very popular in the market because of the exclusivity of her designs and her elaborate decoration. Nora takes classes in this artform at an institution. 

She wants to use the loan to buy leather and metal fittings, so she can increase the quantity and variety of the articles she produces. Her dream is to widen her market and have new distribution channels, which will considerably improve her income and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy leather and metal fittings.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. Angeline has been in this business for 20 years now.

Angeline requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase livestock to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over-sewing machine and renovate her workplace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, air conditioner, table and chair.

loans.name: Yulieth Maritza

texts.es: Yulieth es una joven de 20 años madre de un hijo de dos años; vive con su padre en una zona rural y quien actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante a los vecinos de las veredas cercanas a su vivienda. Ella luego de dejar a su hijo en la guardería, se dirige a visitar a sus clientes para hacer sus ventas; quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de más mercancía (jeans, camisetas, blusas, entre otros) y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle a su bebé mejores condiciones de vida. Su sueño es terminar la secundaria y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Yulieth, who is 20 years old, is a young mother with a two-year-old son. She lives with her father in a rural area and currently makes a living selling clothing as a street vendor to neighbours in the areas near her home. After leaving her son in a nursery, she goes out visiting customers to make her sales.

She wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise (jeans, t-shirts, blouses and other items) and have more variety to offer her customers. Her objective is to improve her income so she can give her baby son better living conditions.

Her dream is to finish her secondary education and make progress in life with her son.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (jeans, t-shirts, blouses and other items).

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 54 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like vinegar, soy sauce, toothpaste, detergent soap, fabric conditioner and other groceries to sell. Julita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of grocery items. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like vinegar, soy sauce, toothpaste, detergent soap, fabric conditioner and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more motorbike spares such as wheel rims, tyres and tools.

loans.name: Ma. Elgafama

texts.en:
Ma. Elgafama is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children, four of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Elgafama has a rug making business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug making business.

Ma. Elgafama has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ma. Elgafama would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more construction goods and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dentistry materials and new tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new sewing machine  and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase juice products.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Musa.  He is married and has 3 children who are 11, 6 and 7 months old.  Two children attend school. 

In 2013, Musa established a business to sell provisions, drinks and electronics. He began his business because he completed school to the primary school level and did not have the opportunity to further his schooling. 

He decided to go into the clothing business.  During his business activities, his shop was robbed and his inventory was stolen.  He went to his elder sister to seek help to re-establish another business.  He was helping his sister to own her business.  The commission he made was saved and later used to establish the drinks, provision and electrical appliances shop.  

The loan will help Musa a lot because he wants to buy more goods for his shop.  He wants to buy crates of soft drinks, bundles of pure water and dozens of electrical appliances.  He works 7 days a week, 14 hours a day to earn 989,000 SLL every month. He would like 3,000,000 SLL to buy crates of soft drinks, bundles of pure water and electrical goods. 

In the future, Musa plans to open another outlet.  Competition is very high in his line of business.  Having another source of capital will help to meet  customers' demand.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks, bundles of pure water, and electrical goods.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a 28-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin city. She has three sons. Her husband works as a taxi driver who earns a  low and unstable income. Kholod helped her husband to meet the family expenses by starting a small center for physical therapy. It is a good business but the tools and medicines are expensive 

Kholod requests a USD loan from FATEN to buy new tools and medicines for her physical therapy center. Kholod will be able to improve her business and increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy new tools and medicines for her physical therapy center.

loans.name: Mary H.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mary H.  She is married and has a 19-year-old daughter who attends school. She has 1 additional dependent,  

Mary H. owns a  hair attachment and cosmetics business. She works 7 days a week, 11 hours a day. She would like to borrow 4,500,000 SLL. Mary H. has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to buy cosmetics and assorted hair attachments. In the future, Mary H. plans to get subsequent loans to improve her business. She has renovated her shop and bought a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and beverages at home.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and assorted hair attachments.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Three years ago, Mohammad started his own business to sell and repair computers. He is very experienced. 

Mohammad requests a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy more computers and repair parts for his store. Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and production.

loans.use: to buy more computers and repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 27-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and two children in a small simple house. 

Four years ago, Isam opened a store to sell shoes which he buys from local factories. It is a good business and he earns a good income. 

Isam took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new collection of shoes to sell.  Isam will be able to improve his store and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy new collection of shoes and resell them.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single young man. He lives with his family in a small house in Jabalia.  Mohammad has owned a small library in the city for two years. This business is very good and the demand is high because there are some schools very close to the book store. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN  to buy more stationery products and books  to resell.  Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more stationery products and books for his book store to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Silvina

texts.en:
Ma. Silvina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Silvina has been in this business for 20 years now.

Ma. Silvina requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Ma. Silvina would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. 

Ayman opened a small restaurant one year ago to sell sandwiches and drinks. He would like to improve his restaurant and expand it in the future. 

Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN to expand his store and buy more tables and chairs. This will increase his sales and also his income.

loans.use: to expand his store and buy more tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 38 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Maricar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Maricar has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sanitary napkins, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.  In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Maralyn has been in this business for 3 years now. 

Marlyn requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. Marlyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and has three children. Jane is married and has three children who are in school.

Jane is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jane requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jane has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 65 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from planting seaweed.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Marieta has been in this business for 15 years. Marieta earns additional income from pig-fattening and a general store.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Malawi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Malawi and consists of four hard-working women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 100, 000 YER from AMB.

Bodoor is a 29-year-old married woman with a 3-year-old child.  She is determined to improve her standard of living and purchase home appliances. She saved a small amount of money and the home appliances which she will purchase are expensive.  Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB  to purchase home appliances.

Bodoor looks forward to opening a savings account in AMB. She expects a boost in her income and enroll her child in a private school.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marivel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Marivel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and tools for her fishing business.

Marivel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and tools for her fishing business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and has five children. Nancy is married and has five children who are in school.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Nancy has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 47 years old and married with four children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She has run a general store for 15 years and earns additional income raising pigs.

Antonieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mirasol has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. Mirasol has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mirasol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with seven children. Clarita is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has operated a general store business for 2 years. Clarita requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Clarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 55 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, coffee, sugar, cereals, chocolate drink, cooking oil, etc. 

Natividad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta works hard to support her family. Dioleta is married and has operated a fishing business for 20 years.

She requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Dioleta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 53-year-old  married woman with four children, 2 attend school. 

Gemma raises pigs and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 2 years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grecilla

texts.en:
Grecilla works hard to support her family.  She is married and raises cattle in the Philippines.  Grecilla has been in this business for 5 years.

She requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Grecilla would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of goods.
